title: School Counselor
description:
**About us**

At Bright Future we are dedicated to providing high-quality after-school care and enrichment programs for children. Our mission is to create a nurturing and stimulating environment where children can thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. We believe in fostering a safe and supportive space that encourages curiosity, creativity, and personal growth.

Our team of dedicated professionals is committed to making a positive impact on the lives of our students. We offer a range of activities and programs designed to complement school learning and provide fun, educational experiences. At Bright Future, we value teamwork, community, and the holistic development of every child

**Job Title:** After School Counselor

**Location:** Bright Future, 125 West 115th Street, New York, NY

**Schedule:**

* Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday: 3:00 PM - 8:00 PM
* Wednesday: 12:00 PM - 8:00 PM

**Job Description:**

Bright Future is seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic After School Counselor to join our team. The ideal candidate will provide a safe and engaging environment for children during after-school hours. This role involves supervising and mentoring students, organizing activities, and ensuring their overall well-being.

**Responsibilities:**

* Supervise and engage with children in a positive and supportive manner.
* Plan and implement age-appropriate activities and enrichment programs.
* Assist with homework and provide academic support.
* Ensure a safe and inclusive environment for all children.
* Communicate effectively with parents and guardians regarding the children’s progress and behavior.
* Maintain accurate records of attendance and incidents.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience working with children in a school or recreational setting preferred.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Reliable, responsible, and committed to creating a positive environment for children.
* High school diploma or equivalent; college coursework in education, child development, or a related field is a plus.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage
* Opportunity to make a positive impact on children’s lives
* Supportive and friendly work environment

**How to Apply:**

Please submit your resume outlining your experience and interest in the position to indeed or brightfuturekiddiehr@gmail.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

**Bright Future is an equal opportunity employer.**

title: Funny Face Bakery Production Operations Manager
description:
**Job Type:** Full-Time

**About Us:**Funny Face Bakery is a thriving bakery dedicated to creating delicious, high-quality gooey cookies and decorative pop culture cookies! We're passionate about what we do, and we're looking for a dedicated Bakery Production Operations Manager to help us take our business to the next level!

**Job Description:** As our Bakery Production Operations Manager, you will play a critical role in managing and optimizing our cookie production process. You will be responsible for overseeing the entire production line, from baking to icing to applying fine details. Your goal is to ensure that our operations run smoothly, efficiently, and cost-effectively while maintaining the high standards of quality our customers expect.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Production Management:** Oversee the entire production process, including baking, icing, and final detailing, ensuring consistency and quality in every batch.
* **Process Optimization:** Analyze current production processes and identify areas for improvement. Implement systems and strategies to streamline operations, reduce waste, and increase output.
* **Cost Management:** Work closely with our team to manage costs, optimize resource allocation, and improve profitability.
* **Team Leadership:** Lead and mentor production staff, ensuring they are well-trained, motivated, and working effectively as a team.
* **Inventory Management:** Monitor ingredient usage and inventory levels, ensuring timely ordering and reducing unnecessary stockpiling.
* **Quality Control:** Maintain high standards of quality across all stages of production, implementing and enforcing quality control measures.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in a production management role, preferably in a bakery or food manufacturing environment. (10 years +)
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and manage a team.
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in process optimization and cost management.
* Knowledge of food safety standards and regulations.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Strong communication skills and attention to detail.

**How to Apply:** If you're excited about the prospect of helping us grow and optimize our bakery production operations, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you're the perfect fit for this role.

title: Accounting Specialist - Accounts Receivable
description:
**Role** 

Kennedys is looking for a full-time Accounting/Accounts Receivable Specialist to join our US Finance team. The successful Accounting Specialist will work as part of the Accounting team, alongside the Billing, Collections, and Finance Database teams, to provide accounting support to Kennedys US internal and external clients.

Our global Finance team is comprised of Billing, Collections, Financial Planning and Reporting, Management Accountants, Credit Control, Legal Accounting and Financial Operations Database professionals located in the UK, US, and Far East.

Kennedys’ US Finance team supports the US offices by producing timely and accurate financial and management information. It also provides reporting solutions and operational support to maintain the high standard of service offered to the firm’s internal and external clients.

Our US Finance team is headquartered in Basking Ridge, New Jersey.

title: Freelance Production Assistant - SNY
description:
**Company Description** **SNY** is an Emmy Award winning, multiplatform regional sports network serving millions of homes throughout the New York Metropolitan area and across the country through unparalleled and exclusive coverage of the New York Mets, New York Jets, UConn women’s basketball and all things New York sports.

 **Job Description**  

As a Freelance Production Assistant, you will play a vital role in supporting our production team in various phases of production. From researching players and teams to assisting with editing and preparing scripts, you will contribute to the creation of engaging sports content for our views.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Research players, teams, stories, and statistics
* Assist production personnel in all phases of production
* Support in editing pieces, preparing scripts, coordination, and conducting necessary research where required
* Assist with and create graphics
* Screen and log video footage
* Research, prepare, and insert statistics to be displayed on tickers
* Continue to enhance skills necessary to autonomously assume various roles in sports production, such as editing sports television and/or video segments, including highlight packages, features, bumpers, and teases. This involves cueing shots, securing footage, and collaborating effectively with assigned editors to ensure seamless content creation.

**DESIRED COMPETENCIES:**

* Attention to Detail: Ability to maintain accuracy and meticulousness in all tasks.
* Adaptability: Readiness to learn and adapt to changing situations. Effectively manage high-pressure, live scenarios (both inside and outside the control room) with a positive and constructive attitude when interacting with colleagues, talent, management, fellow production staff, and other departments.
* Team Player: Ability to work effectively with peers and management across teams.
* Creativity: Capacity to bring innovative ideas to the production process.

  

**Qualifications** **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Thorough knowledge of both local and national sports
* Solid attention to detail and accuracy
* Comprehensive understanding of sports statistics and abbreviations
* Proficient in grammar and spelling skills to ensure accuracy and clarity in written communications
* Excellent communication abilities, both verbally and in written form, to effectively convey information and ideas
* Willingness to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, holidays, and non-traditional business hours

**ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS:**

* Interested and qualified candidates must submit a resume / CV through www.nbcunicareers.com
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
* Must be 18 years or older
* Must be willing to work in New York, NY

**LOCATION:**This role is onsite at our New York City headquarters.

**REPORTS TO:**Coordinating Content Manager


In accordance with applicable NYC law, the estimated hourly rate for this role is $19.00 - $22.50 commensurate with experience.

title: Case Manager
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a compassionate and experienced Case Manager to join our team. The Case Manager will play a vital role in providing support and guidance to individuals and families in need. The successful candidate will be responsible for assessing, planning, and implementing interventions to address a range of issues related to behavioral health, and addiction. If you have a passion for social work, a background in crisis management, and a commitment to improving the lives of others, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding opportunity.

Duties:

- Provide one-on-one support to clients, including crisis intervention, counseling, and advocacy.  
- Conduct thorough assessments of client needs, including those related to behavioral health, addiction, and child welfare.  
- Develop and implement personalized plans to address client needs, including referrals to community resources and medical services.  
- Collaborate with other professionals, such as healthcare providers, addiction counselors, and childcare workers, to ensure comprehensive support for clients.  
- Monitor client progress, identifying areas of success and areas for improvement, and adjusting plans accordingly.  
- Facilitate group sessions, workshops, and support groups to promote skill-building, social connection, and community engagement.  
- Engage in workforce development initiatives to help clients achieve their employment goals.  
- Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, including Medicare guidelines.  
- Maintain accurate and timely records of client interactions, assessments, and progress.

Requirements:

- A bachelor's degree in social work, counseling, or a related field.  
- At least two years of experience in case management, crisis management, or a related field.  
- Strong knowledge of behavioral health, addiction counseling, and child welfare principles and practices.  
- Ability to work effectively in high-pressure situations, including crisis intervention and emergency situations.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build trust with clients and colleagues.  
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office and electronic medical records (EMRs).  
- Experience with Medicare and other healthcare programs.  
- Certification in crisis intervention, addiction counseling, or a related field is preferred.

This is an exciting opportunity for a dedicated and compassionate Case Manager to make a positive impact in the lives of others. If you are passionate about social work and are committed to providing high-quality support to individuals and families in need, we encourage you to apply.

title: Supervisor, Assembly/Test
description:
About Us
Spellman High Voltage Electronics Corporation, a family owned business for over 75 years, takes pride in powering progress in health, security and quality of life. We are key partners with the world’s leading medical devices, semiconductor, scientific analytics and industrial systems manufacturers. When they want to push the limits of what’s possible with high voltage applications, they turn to us to make it happen.
While Spellman is not a household name, our products are used to make and often power many of the most advanced technologies that make modern life possible. With design and manufacturing sites in North America, Europe and Asia, we have become the preferred provider of high voltage power solutions for OEMs pushing the boundaries of technology around the world by designing and producing the products they need to power progress.
Supervises all aspects of the organization's manufacturing operations. Develop and implement plans to efficiently utilize material, labor and equipment. Ensure that all parts and assemblies are produced on schedule and according to established requirements. Ensures manufacturing performance and KPI’s are met.
What You Will Do:* Supervise the activities of Leads / individual contributors in both assembly and test.
* Responsible for hiring, firing, performance appraisals and pay reviews.
* Drive continuous improvements through lean/six sigma methodologies.
* Participate in project teams in support of improvement activities with the Team.
* Cultivate a positive and respectful work environment by developing strong relationships with internal and external customers.
* Monitor and improve failure rates, efficiencies and OTD. Report regularly to the Operations Production Manager on all KPIs, including capacity planning and performance issues. Work with appropriate departments to recommend and implement changes to build/test methods.
* Review and supervise new product releases in production. Adhere to and enforce all company policies and procedures.
* Ensure compliance with ISO regulations and guidelines


Education:* Associate’s degree in engineering or business administration preferred.
* Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt preferred


What You Need :* 4+ years’ work-related experience with 1 year minimum operating in a leadership capacity.
* Required computer skills: Microsoft Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, AutoCAD LT viewer, ERP systems
* Ability to perform basic WO transactions (completions, issues, reallocations)
* Ability to communicate clearly and consistently at all levels of the organization either up or down
* Project management/prioritization and presentation skills
* Ability to plan and meet deadlines
* Detail oriented
* Maturity to handle changing priorities and circumstances in a professional, positive and productive manner
* Well-developed teamwork ethic
* Strong creative problem solving skills


Our good faith estimate of the wage range for this role is $90,000 - $100,000. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and other factors. In addition to base pay, we offer a full benefits package.
We at Spellman High Voltage Electronics Corporation believe that each individual is entitled to equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, creed, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status or disability. The right of equal employment opportunity extends to recruiting, hiring selection, transfer, promotion, training and all other conditions of employment. title: Home Care Field Nurse | LHCSA
description:
**Large Licensed Home Care Agency (LHCSA) is seeking an RN to see patients in Westchester only!**

**Great opportunity for RN who enjoys the flexibility of being in the field.** 

**Salary is open based on experience + excellent health benefits, PTO and 401k.** 

**Responsibilities:**

* Initial assessments, reassessments and supervision of HHAs
* Assesses the patient/family situation for nursing and health related problems.
* Provides nursing care to patients requiring part time or intermittent professional nursing care at home.
* Develops and coordinates the plan of care specific to the needs of individual patients in conjunction with all health team members.
* Instructs and supervise patients, caregivers, LPNs, and home health aides in aspects of patient care as appropriate.
* Reports significant conditions/symptoms to the patient’s physician and modifies the plan of care accordingly.
* Initiates appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures.
* Educates the patient/family regarding the disease process, self care techniques and prevention strategies.
* Evaluates the effectiveness and outcomes of care.
* Consults with and refers to other professionals or agencies in the community concerning patient needs
* Interprets to patient/families Agency policies, procedures and federal/state/local laws and regulations affecting service or entitlements.
* Documents, on a timely basis, all nursing service provided to patients as well as periodic reports to coordinate care and remain in compliance with state/federal regulations.
* Systematically plans for discharge from service.
* Effectively manages document flow and confidentiality of patient records as per Agency policy.
* Demonstrates a knowledge of and adherence to agency policy as well as state/federal regulations governing home care service.
* Participates in program evaluation, research, educational programs and other agency activities as appropriate.
* Maintains sufficient service productivity to meet agency goals and objectives.
* Participates in activities to enhance professional growth.
* Participates in the orientation of new staff.
* Participates in the student nurse program as assigned.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* License and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in the State of New York.
* Minimum of 1 to 2 years experience as a registered nurse in either Medical/Surgical nursing or home care
* Ability to assess and respond to the needs of patients and families in the home setting.
* Professional Liability Insurance
* Able to drive with automobile in good working order and available for use in the field.
* Ability to master basic computer skills.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Operations Manager - Financial Services - Grow with Us! (#16490222)
description:
Madison Trust / Broad Financial is an integrated, rapidly growing, Bergen County-based financial services group comprised of a chartered trust company, an IRA services specialty group, multiple alternative investment fund affiliates, and a real estate group.

We've been rated one of NJ's best places to work and maintain a superb work culture!

title: Hotel Operations Manager
description:
Hotel Operations Manager

All areas involved with the maintenance and cleanliness of the building and grounds.

Responsible for the cleanliness, appearance, upkeep, organization and functionality of the guest rooms, public space, back of house and grounds. Ensures that all housekeeping and maintenance staff are well trained and supervised. Responsible for driving The Lodge Red Hook’s policies and procedures for the housekeeping and maintenance staff.

1) Previous Hotel Operations Management experience

2) Knowledge of computers, hotel operating systems

3) Possess a good command of the English language and ability to clearly and pleasantly communicate with guests, both in person and by telephone.

4) Thorough knowledge of hotel services and facilities

5) Basic knowledge of plumbing, electrical and construction

6) FLSD Certified

1) Must have professional image and personality exuding confidence and leadership skills

2) Be an ambassador of The Lodge Red Hook at all times, in and outside of one’s workplace.

3) Ability to focus attention to details and be able to organize, prioritize and follow-up.

4) Must be able to take initiative and work productively within any given period, unsupervised.

5) Ability to maintain confidentiality and security of all guests and general hotel information.

6) Must be a team player, working well with other departments and coworkers.

***7) Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and evenings if necessary.***

8) Ability to go the extra mile, to provide the extra attention to satisfy guests’ individual needs and wants.

9) Should be creative, innovative and strive for continuous improvement.

10) Should display leadership qualities regarding thinking clearly, quickly, and making decisions.

11) Ability to promote positive relationships with all guests in the hotel and company.

12) Ability to prioritize and organize work assignments; delegate work and assist the maintenance team in completing their assigned work.

13) Ability to direct performance of staff and follow up with corrections where needed.

14) Ability to motivate staff and maintain a cohesive team and limit employee turnover.

15) Ability to ascertain departmental training needs and provide such training.

16) Ability to be a clear thinker, analyze and resolve problems exercising good judgment.

17) Ability to remain calm and courteous with demanding/difficult guests and/or situations.

18) Meet all deadlines and requests given by Management and maintain a preventative maintenance schedule.

1) Evaluate the staffing requirements and manage work schedules daily, adhering to budget goals and adjusting to stay within budgeted labor.

2) Ensure that enough staffing is present to meet the daily business demands.

3) Handle disciplinary counseling proactively and as needed according to BHG Hospitality Management policy.

4) Communicate anticipated business demands daily with each employee.

5) Ensure staff has knowledge of hotel services, features, and amenities.

6) Assign specific as they arise through ALICE and monitor/follow up with each task to ensure tasks are completed quickly and efficiently in the allotted time frame.

7) Monitor and ensure that the Maintenance and housekeeping = staff performs their job functions to the hotel’s expected level of service.

8) Assist the Maintenance and housekeeping staff with whenever is necessary in performing all job functions so that each task and assignment is completed quickly, efficiently and within the allotted time frame.

9) Conduct ongoing training with existing staff and ensure that new staff are certified as required.

10) Accommodate all guest requests in an accurate and efficient manner, follow up within 20 minutes. Ensure each request was properly logged in ALICE and closed out.

11) Monitor and maintain cleanliness and working conditions of equipment and supplies through daily inspections and preventative maintenance. All supplies must be organized and properly stored at all times.

12) Prepare work orders for equipment repairs and distribute to staff through Nuvola.

13) Ensure all supplies are ordered with accurate usage factors and are received in a timely manner.

14) Ensure that all pertinent information is documented in the Operations Daily Spreadsheet. All audits and inspections must be turned in the day of audit/inspection by scanning the form and emailing to the General Manager.

15) Conduct performance appraisals of designated staff as required.

16) Oversee all receiving and ensure deliveries are immediately stored in the correct places.

17) Ensure all FDNY, DOB, HPD and DHS logs, certifications and violations are properly logged, up to date and in accordance with local rules and regulations.

***18) Hotel Operations Manager is expected to spend 50% of shift on the floor with maintenance team.***

title: Receptionist
description:
**Job Title:** Receptionist

**Job Summary:**  
We are seeking a friendly, organized, and professional Receptionist to join our team. The Receptionist will be the first point of contact for our company, responsible for managing the front desk, greeting visitors, and handling a variety of administrative tasks. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.  
**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Greet Visitors:** Welcome guests as they arrive, providing a warm and professional first impression. Direct visitors to the appropriate person or department.
* **Manage Phone Calls:** Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls. Take accurate messages and ensure they are delivered promptly.
* **Administrative Support:** Perform general administrative duties, including data entry, filing, and managing office supplies. Assist with scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
* **Mail Handling:** Receive, sort, and distribute incoming mail and packages. Prepare outgoing mail and coordinate courier services as needed.
* **Maintain Reception Area:** Ensure the reception area is tidy, organized, and presentable at all times.
* **Visitor Management:** Maintain a log of visitors, issue visitor badges, and ensure adherence to security protocols.
* **Customer Service:** Address and resolve inquiries or complaints from clients and visitors, providing information and assistance as needed.
* **Office Coordination:** Assist with coordinating office events, meetings, and other activities. Support various departments with additional tasks as required.
* **Technology Management:** Operate office equipment such as printers, copiers, and fax machines. Troubleshoot minor technical issues.
* **Confidentiality:** Handle sensitive information with discretion and in accordance with company policies.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent required. An associate degree or additional certification in office administration or a related field is a plus.
* **Experience:** Proven experience as a Receptionist, Front Office Representative, or similar role preferred.
* **Skills:**
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and familiarity with office equipment.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Professional appearance and demeanor.
* Ability to handle stressful situations with calm and professionalism.
* Customer service orientation.
* **Work Environment:** Ability to work in a standard office environment. Some light lifting (up to 20 pounds) may be required.

title: P/T DENTAL CASE ASSISTANT
description:
**Hearts & Homes for Refugees** is a volunteer-driven nonprofit organization that resettles refugees in our communities and inspires, educates and equips others to do the same. We harness the power of volunteers, create, mentor and mobilize groups to support holistic refugee resettlement. Private citizen volunteers improve the long-term outcomes for refugees and change the lives of our new neighbors as well as those who offer their time and resources.

**Location:** Westchester, NY / hybrid

**Position:** Hearts & Homes for Refugees is seeking applicants for a part-time dental professional to provide oversight of dental treatment plans for our refugee client population. This position will include the following: acting as the point person for staff and volunteers assisting clients with dental needs; triaging those dental needs; interfacing with dental providers and insurance providers on behalf of the clients; tracking client dental expenses and HHR contributions; and; consulting with the Dental Advisory Panel when needed to determine the best treatment plan for a particular client.

**Required Experience:** Minimum of 2 years of relevant professional experience in the dental field (general dentist, endodontist, hygienist, etc). Experience working with marginalized populations a plus.

**Skills and Competencies:**

Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a multicultural environment.

Excellent problem-solving abilities, self-starter mentality and the capacity to work flexibly and adaptively.

Ability to work with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets).

*COVID-19 Policy: Proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required as part of HHR's commitment to providing a safe working environment for employees, clients, and the community.*

Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume to erin@heartsandhomesforrefugees.org, detailing their relevant experience and interest in the position.

title: Restoration Mitigation Manager
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Free uniforms
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

  

Are you a proactive leader with a passion for restoration, a knack for inspiring teams and helping customers in their time of need? We are seeking a **Mitigation Manager** to join our dynamic team and lead the charge in delivering top-notch services related to fire restoration, water damage restoration, mold remediation, and asbestos abatement. This role will provide direction and coordination of all emergency services and mitigation field activities related to technicians, trade partners, subcontractors as well as estimating efforts.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* **Lead and Inspire**: Together with the Production Manager, oversee restoration projects from start to finish, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget. Guide the MIT team by setting clear expectations and providing the tools they need to excel.
* **Team Development**: Train and mentor team members on proper restoration techniques and industry best practices to foster a high-performing, collaborative, supportive culture.
* **Emergency Response**: Collaborate on emergency response plans and manage duties related to emergency calls.
* **On-Site Inspections**: Conduct site inspections to assess damage and enact appropriate mitigation actions.
* **Estimating**: Utilize Xactimate software to prepare detailed estimates, covering materials, labor, and equipment costs for residential and commercial water, fire, and mold mitigation projects.
* **Insurance Coordination**: Work with insurance companies to negotiate settlements and define project scopes, adhering to IICRC standards and building codes.
* **Project Management**: Coordinate all aspects of emergency service & mitigation projects, including water damage restoration, fire restoration, and mold remediation, following IICRC standards. Monitor project progress, subcontractors, budget, and quality control. Prepare and submit permits as needed.
* **Jobsite Documentation**: Ensure complete documentation is recorded for all projects in Encircle software, including progress photos, PPE utilization, job notes and moisture mapping information.
* **Compliance and Safety**: Implement safety protocols and procedures to maintain a secure work environment.
* **Equipment & Supply Management**: Supervise the maintenance of all mitigation equipment and track supply inventory. As required on occasion, utilize power tools, hand tools, and specialized mitigation equipment.
* **Fleet Vehicle Upkeep**: Participate in the coordination of fleet vehicle maintenance and make sure all MIT vehicles are kept clean, organized and properly stocked.
* **Client Communication**: Maintain open lines of communication with clients, ensuring their needs are met and expectations exceeded. Provide regular updates and address any concerns promptly.

**Job Qualifications:**  

* **Experience**: Minimum of 5+ years of relevant team management experience in the restoration industry.
* **Xactimate estimating software**: Expert level
* **Certifications**: IICRC, WRT/ASD preferred

Capable of working efficiently under pressure to meet tight deadlines. Excellent communication skills to interact with clients, team members, and stakeholders.
* **Knowledge**: Deep understanding of the restoration industry, including water damage restoration, fire restoration, and mold remediation. Familiarity with insurance claim processes and guidelines.
* **Background Check:** Must pass pre-employment background check
* **Driver’s License**: Valid NJ driver’s license with a clean driving record
* In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

**Why Join Us?**  

* **Dynamic Team**: Be part of a team that values collaboration and excellence.
* **Growth Opportunities**: We support your professional development and career growth.
* **Impactful Work**: Make a real difference by helping clients restore their properties and lives.

 **Schedule:**
  

* Monday-Friday

* + Bonus & 3% Sales Commission on self-generated sales

* Company Vehicle for business use
* Medical & Dental Insurance for employee if needed – after 90-day probationary period (company pays 50% of insurance premiums – 50% deducted from employee payroll)
* Paid Holidays + 2 floating holidays (as per Employee Handbook guidelines)

* Sick Days (5 per Anum) – after 90-day probationary period
* 401K with 4% Company Match – after 90-day probationary period

**About The Company:**  

**A GRADE Property Restoration** is one of New Jersey’s leading Fire, Water, Storm property repair contractors. Serving the Tri-State area, we are a full-service restoration company licensed and certified by the IICRC for mold, asbestos abatement, fire, smoke, and water damage repairs. From trees crashing through houses, large residential fires, removing asbestos shingle siding to burst water lines, we are experts at dealing with insurance companies and getting the property owners the funds needed to make repairs.  

  

We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Assistant Manager
description:
**Job Summary**  

  

The **Assistant Manager** will be responsible for assisting in the oversight of gym operations to ensure an exceptional “Judgement Free” member experience as well as a financially successful club.  

  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**  

  

* Assist in recruiting, hiring, training and developing a high performing staff consisting of Member Service Representatives, Trainers and Custodians.
* Assist in maintaining a welcoming atmosphere for all members, prospective members and guests and ensuring staff follows superior customer service guidelines.
* Assist with Staff Management and provide backup support to Club Manager as needed.  

	+ Assist in scheduling and supervising staff.
* + Member service oversight - Ensuring staff is providing a superior customer experience at all times.
* + Assist in resolving or escalating employee issues or concerns.
* Involved in all front desk related activities including:  

	+ Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with a variety of questions.
* + Check members into the system.
* + New member sign-up.
* + Take prospective members on tours.
* + Facilitate all member requests, issues and questions.
* Assist in overseeing cleanliness and maintenance of facility.
* Assist in ordering of supplies using specific budget based on club requirements.
* Assist in tracking statistics and reports (weekly, monthly, and annually).
* Backup support for any employee who is absent.

**Qualifications/Requirements**  

  

* Superior customer service skills, preferably in the fitness industry.
* Experience working as a Member Service Representative at Planet Fitness.
* Solid supervisory, diplomacy and listening skills.
* Basic computer proficiency (Microsoft Suite).
* Hard working, enthusiastic and energetic!
* Strong problem resolution skills.
* Current CPR Certification required.
* High school diploma/GED equivalent required.
* Must be 18 year of age or older.

**Physical Demands**  

  

* Continual standing and walking during shift.
* Continual talking in person or on the phone during shift.
* Must be able to occassionally lift up to 50 lbs.
* Will occasionally encounter toxic chemicals during shift.

  

*Employees at a franchise location are employed by the Franchisee and are not employees of PFHQ (the Franchisor). PFHQ neither dictates nor controls labor or employment matters for franchisees or their employees, and does not retain any reserved authority to control the terms and conditions of employment for franchisees or their employees. Each franchisee is responsible for ensuring compliance with local, state and federal law.*
company_description: Planet Fitness created the Judgement Free Zone® because we believe anyone, of any fitness level, should feel accepted and respected when they walk into a gym.

title: Studio Manager - F45 Training Boerum Hill
description:
**Benefits:** Benefits are very important to us. We are constantly looking for ways to increase our benefit package to attract and retain top candidates.  

* Flexible schedule
* Free Membership at F45
* Competitive salary and bonus structure

  

  

Our F45 family is looking to grow our management team. As Studio Manager, you will be responsible for providing leadership and direction to the team at this studio. As the lead for the Sales function, the Studio Manager must execute a lead generation/marketing strategies plan to increase fitness membership sales, as well as promote the health and wellness benefits associated with a healthy lifestyle. The Studio Manager is not only a mentor, but an Ambassador of our brand, and a proven leader.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

* Create, properly manage and exceed, all Sales and Operational budgets
* Lead our team of personal trainers.
* Coach 20 + F45 classes per week
* Drive financial plans and increase gross margins of the business through optimal programming and capacity utilization
* Create an annual marketing plan for social media, digital/print marketing, and community events
* Ensure all Front Desk systems and studio practices/processes are adhered to, including member check-in, telephone inquiries, payment handling, delinquent account procedures, and customer care calls
* Ensure a consistent sales effort is maintained at all times by providing daily sales goals and contests/incentive-based motivation, including establishing, expanding, and tracking outreach initiatives and strategic partnerships with local businesses, community groups, and charitable organizations
* Recruit, hire, train and deliver the onboarding program for all staff
* Maintain and grow the total membership base and oversee all aspects of the membership sales process
* Increase studio conversion rate and achieve client retention goals
* Drive client referral program
* Maintain top-notch cleanliness, appearance, and organization of the studio and inventory
* Demonstrate positive attitude and actions through a display of courtesy, service, cooperation, hospitality, sensitivity and professionalism to both clients and internal staff
* Ensure studio branding by adhering to company guidelines and values
* Maintain strong working knowledge of our small-group training programs by participating in at least two (2) training sessions per week
* Manage and oversee all day-to-day operations and overall studio performance.

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience, required
* 2+ years of proven sales leadership in the Health & Fitness industry required
* Must have Personal Training Certification through a nationally recognized organization
* Must have CPR/AED/First Aid Certification
* 3+ years of management experience, including directly overseeing all aspects of staff management from hiring, training, supporting, disciplining, and terminating
* Must have outstanding experience delivering high-quality customer service, excellent communication, organizational, and written skills
* Must possess excellent leadership and management skills to create a positive, successful environment for staff and clients
* Ability to work independently and collaborate with Studio Owner, Sales Associates, and client
* Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
* Computer proficiency with MS Office programs, MindBody Online, GloFox, as well as various media platforms

  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to F45 Corporate.*

title: Grocery Packer and Delivery Driver
description:
**Position Overview:**

SNACC (Sustainable Nutrition And Community Connection) is seeking a reliable and dedicated Delivery Driver to join our team. The Delivery Driver will play a vital role in ensuring the smooth distribution of weekly groceries to households in the Bronx and Harlem. The ideal candidate is organized, detail-oriented, and possesses excellent communication skills. This is a part-time position requiring approximately 3-4 hours of work on Sunday's.

**Responsibilities:**

* Receive weekly grocery deliveries at your home/apartment and organize items for efficient distribution.
* Repackage groceries into approximately 20 bags, ensuring accurate and fair distribution.
* Deliver groceries to approximately 20 households in designated areas.
* Communicate effectively with recipients, confirming delivery times and addressing any inquiries.
* Ensure timely and accurate deliveries, considering recipients' schedules and needs.
* Handle cases where items are missing from deliveries by either revisiting the grocery store for additional items or coordinating with the SNACC team.
* Collaborate with the SNACC team to maintain an organized and efficient delivery schedule.
* Provide feedback to the SNACC team on any issues or challenges encountered during deliveries.
* Adhere to all safety guidelines and traffic regulations while driving.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Can speak English and Spanish (requirement).
* Valid driver's license and a clean driving record.
* Access to a reliable vehicle for deliveries. Vehile must have air-conditioning to ensure food safety and temperature control.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Excellent time management and organizational abilities.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in packaging and distributing groceries.
* Ability to problem-solve and adapt to changes in delivery schedules or items.
* Patience and a customer-focused attitude.
* Openness to feedback and willingness to learn.
* Physical capability to lift and carry bags of groceries.
* Familiarity with local neighborhoods and navigation apps is a plus.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Seasonal

* Morning shift

* Weekends only

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

title: Territory Supervisor
description:
**Territory Supervisor (TS)**


The Territory Supervisor (TS) is a part-time position which is responsible for supervising a group of Retail Merchandisers within a specific geography. Retail Merchandisers maintain card departments and outposts for both every day and seasonal products. In addition, they participate in installation activities which include building Hallmark fixtures, moving card departments, installing new stores, store relocations, and card department remodels.

  



This is your opportunity to represent the world's best-known greeting card brand and develop retailer relationships in your community. Hallmark provides paid training, paid travel time and mileage reimbursement between stores and access to a variety of corporate discounts.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**
--------------------



1) Supervise/Manage Service:


* Supervise a team of on average, 5 to 10 Retail Merchandisers, ensuring well maintained card departments and timely execution of everyday and seasonal programs
* Document and manage performance with manager feedback and input
* Handle retailer concerns, retail execution issues and retail merchandiser performance issues by working with store management, retail merchandisers and/or your manager
* Work is typically Monday through Friday during day/early evening hours
* Weekend work may be required during major holiday periods


2) Department Remodels and Resets:


* Prepare, direct and follow-up on minor installation which involve resetting product, building fixtures and merchandising product
* Lead or participate in major installations when business exceptions require additional support
* Major installations could involve moving the card department, building fixtures and merchandising product

**A TERRITORY SUPERVISOR MUST BE A STRONG:**
--------------------------------------------


* Leader who can inspire, empower and inform your team
* People manager who can give constructive feedback, coaching and support
* Decision maker who can work independently and direct your team accordingly with minimal supervision from your manager
* Problem solver who can resolve conflicts at store level and within your team

**A TERRITORY SUPERVISOR MUST DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY TO:**
-----------------------------------------------------------


* Motivate a group of individuals in person and from a distance
* Follow through on commitments
* Lead by example in the implementation of company best practices
* Be a change champion who can effectively manage change and lead others through change
* Delegate when necessary
* Identify, analyze and solve problems
* Be organized, manage time well and perform administrative tasks
* Build strong customer relationships

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS - All Positions**
-----------------------------------------



This is a physically demanding job that requires a high level of energy and a sense of urgency. You will be working on the selling floor as well as in back stockrooms. You must be able to consistently push, pull, lift, and carry cartons, merchandise and display fixtures up to 30 pounds throughout the workday and up to 50 pounds on occasion. You will also be required to stoop, squat, walk, and stand throughout your workday, and you may be required to climb stairs and step ladders.


**REQUIREMENTS - All Positions**
--------------------------------


* Access to a Wi-Fi network and the internet
* Able to operate hand-held technology provided to open and read documents and interpret information
* Flexibility to work a changing work schedule that may include an occasional evening or weekend
* Reliable transportation to report to assigned locations as scheduled
* Eligible to work in the United States
* Able to read, understand and communicate in English
* At least 18 years of age
* Required to work the week before and the week after major holidays


Part-time employees with a work schedule less than 30 hours have access to a variety of voluntary benefits through ; including dental, vision, critical illness, accident insurance, hospital indemnity and minimum essential coverage (preventive care).  

  

The hourly pay for this position will be upto $21.00

title: Assistant Behavioral Intervention Specialist
description:
**About the Position:**  
YAI has an opening for an Assistant Behavior Intervention Specialist. YAI promotes a person-centered approach by creating supports that cater to the specific needs of each person. Join our dynamic team teaching daily and independent living skills, providing individual and group counseling, and promoting community integration. The ideal candidate will have enthusiasm for working with people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and a willingness to help with Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) such as assisting with showering, toileting, grooming, laundry and housekeeping as necessary. ABIS works directly with people in their home, work, and daily life in varying capacities. An ABIS must have previously worked as a DSP, completed all the required trainings and demonstrated all the knowledge, skills and accountabilities of a Direct Service Professional Level three.  
The Asst. BIS position blends together the DSP role and the clinical leadership role. Clinical leadership under the supervision of the BIS includes educating team members on habilitative and Behavior Support Plans, assisting with clinical assessments, ensuring data collection and providing direct feedback and education to all team members.

**Mission Statement YAI:**  
YAI is a network of agencies offering people with intellectual and developmental disabilities a comprehensive range of services across all ages. YAI empowers people with disabilities to reach their goals every day. Our enthusiastic staff of over 4,000 professionals believes that everyone has a fundamental right to live, love, work, and learn. If you share our vision and want to help support people to live the fullest lives possible, apply to this position.

**Location**: Westchester County, NY (Multiple Locations)

**Schedule**: Full-Time

**Key responsibilities:**  
- To provide direct care services as needed. This includes, but not limited to, the provision of direct counseling, implementation of each individual’s treatment plan, training in ADL skills, assistance with personal care, medical, dietary, social, sexual, recreational, financial, habilitative and other needs within the program.  
- To train staff, which includes, but is not limited to, using the EMOE training system to ensure that all clinical interventions are properly implemented, to communicate clinical rationales to the staff, to provide staff with both formal and informal feedback, and role model at all times appropriate tone, implementing of habilitative and behavioral programming, and appropriate data collection techniques  
- Role Model use of person-centered philosophy and use of person-centered tools  
- To develop written, individualized habilitative plans in accordance with the agency philosophy, as determined by individual need.  
- To conduct assessments – both behavioral and habilitative via formal means (written questionnaires, rating scales, baseline data, etc.) and informal (observations), under the supervision of the BIS.  
- To design effective data collection systems that allows progress to be monitored. To monitor the data collection, ensure that the data is totaled and summarized on a monthly basis and that new data sheets are accessible to staff at the beginning of each month.  
- To oversee/maintain the completion of all required paperwork, including monthlies, Person Centered materials, and ensure that all pertinent information is included on psychiatric anecdotals.  
- To provide the appropriate therapeutically documented level of an individual’s supervision to ensure and protect the individual’s health/safety and well-being. Whenever this level is unclear or unknown, to provide the maximum level of supervision to assure and protect the individual’s health and safety.  
- Train new staff on Level 1 competencies  
- Resource to staff by providing clinical support in absence of the BIS/Supervisor  
- Lead trainer of weekend staff on clinical interventions

**Education and Experience:**  
- BA/BS Degree in Psychology or Human Services strongly preferred or  
- Enrolled in 4-year degree in Psychology or Human Services field  
- Experience working within the field of ID/DD preferred

**Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  
- Exceptional interpersonal, problem solving and communication skills  
- Willing to take initiative  
- Highly flexible to varied work schedule  
- Experience in computer skills and ability to teach others  
- College level writing ability.  
- Must demonstrate assertiveness/leadership skills.  
- Must demonstrate clinical skills

**Schedule:** Full Time

**Compensation:** $22.00/hr.

description:
**Looking to hire a DSP that is available after school hours and/or weekends- 18 hours total per week.**

Seeking an experienced support professional who has chosen this field because they are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through a career in health or mental care.

You have at least a high school degree with experience in direct and active support of people with autism, down's syndrome, etc. or even better, a bachelor's degree in a field related to health and mental care: psychology, special education, mental health, behavioral science, etc. We offer competitive pay and benefits in a fast-growing, start-up-like environment where the right combination of independent, creative thinking and enthusiastic teamwork will guarantee career growth.

You will be responsible for supporting our program participant.

* Ensure health, safety and welfare of client with developmental disabilities.
* Safeguard and respect the confidentiality of the individual and their family.
* Promote individual's independence.
* Assist to develop and maintain relationships.

* Commit to person-centered supports and honor the personality, preferences, culture and strengths of the client.
* Work in partnership with client to support to lead self-directed lives.
* Implement and adhere to established actionable plans.
* Ability to communicate effectively.
* Be able to establish rapport and communicate positively with parents.
* Provide information to parents about behaviors and interactions with the child.

**Administrative & Company Policies**

* Uphold the standards set by the National Alliance for Direct Support Professionals (NADSP) Code of Ethics.
* Be familiar with fire evacuation and emergency procedures within the home and community environments.

* Report problems and concerns to supervisors immediately
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management

**Education/Qualifications**

* High school diploma required, bachelors or masters preferred.
* Experience working with medically fragile people and with people with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
* Valid driver’s license and impeccable driving record.

3. May provide direct supervision for mental health counselors assigned at Level I.

4. May represent the department at conferences, workshops, hospital or community functions; reports actions and findings to department.

5. May develop and conduct departmental training programs to introduce new developments and techniques within the mental health counseling discipline, residential treatment or outpatient treatment services.

**Preferred Skills:**

Assignment Level II

1. A valid License issued by the New York State Education Department to practice as a Mental Health Counselor; and

2. Two years of full-time, paid, professional experience providing direct client care in a behavior health setting.

The administration of assessment and screening instruments does not include the administration or interpretation of Intelligence (IQ) tests, Projective tests, or Neuropsychological tests or instruments.

None. This position is in the non-competitive class

**Minimum Qualification** 

Assignment Level I  
1. A valid License or Limited Permit issued by the New York State Education Department to practice as a Mental Health Counselor.

Assignment Level II  
1. A valid License issued by the New York State Education Department to practice as a Mental Health Counselor; and  
2. Two years of full-time, paid, professional experience providing direct client care in a  
behavior health setting.

Assignment Level III  
In addition to meeting the requirements for Assignment Levels II, Assignment Level III  
requires:  
1. Three additional years of post-licensure experience.

title: Entry Level Sales Representative
description:
Are you a persuasive communicator with a talent for building rapport? Do you have a passion for home improvement and a keen eye for design? SECI Construction Inc is looking for a dynamic Door-to-Door Appointment Setter to join our team!

In this role, you'll engage with homeowners in the local community, promote our top-notch roofing and exterior improvement services, and schedule appointments for our sales representatives. This position offers excellent growth opportunities, attractive incentives, and the chance to be part of a successful, well-established company. If you’re ready to make an impact and grow with us, we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct door-to-door visits in residential neighborhoods to introduce homeowners to SECI Construction Inc.'s products and services and set appointments for windows, siding, and roofing estimates.
* Engage directly with potential customers at their homes. No cold calling or selling required.
* Provide accurate information about our company's services, pricing, and warranties.
* Schedule appointments for interested homeowners to meet with our experienced sales representatives for in-home consultations.
* Maintain detailed records of interactions, leads generated, and appointment schedules.
* Collaborate with the sales team to ensure a seamless customer experience throughout the sales process.
* Stay updated on industry trends and product knowledge to address customer queries confidently.

**Requirements:**

* Previous experience in sales, customer service, or canvassing is preferred but not required. We value enthusiasm and a positive attitude.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
* Ability to effectively engage with customers and provide exceptional customer service
* Proficiency in using CRM software, Salesforce, and other sales technology tools
* Comfortable working outdoors and in various weather conditions.
* Basic computer skills to maintain records and schedule appointments.
* Knowledge of Roofing and Exterior Improvements is a plus but not mandatory; we provide comprehensive training.
* Applicants must have a valid driver's license, a car, smartphone and US citizenship.
* Fluency in English and Spanish is a plus

**Benefits:**

* Competitive Based pay plus commission with generous commission structure.
* Performance-based bonuses and incentives.
* Comprehensive training and ongoing support to enhance your sales skills.
* Opportunity for career advancement within SECI Construction Inc
* Flexible working hours and a dynamic, friendly work environment.
* The satisfaction of offering high-quality products that enhance homeowners' lives.

***Join the SECI Construction Inc team and be part of a company that values its employees and customers alike. If you have the drive to succeed in sales and want to make a significant impact in the Roofing and Exterior Improvements. Apply now and let's discuss how you can become an integral part of our success story!***

title: Assistant Supervisor
description:
**About the Position**:

We are currently seeking a high energy, self-starting individual to supervise our Rockland Program. A person's managerial and clinical skills will be maximized in an interdisciplinary team environment, where there is ongoing support and training. The Rockland Assistant Supervisor is responsible for providing staff training, mentoring and supervision of 5-15 direct reports. The Supervisor will need to be able to provide program oversight, quality assurance, maintain NYS regulations, oversee clinical programming, be an advocate for the people we support and be a liaison with families. The ideal candidate will have enthusiasm for working directly with people of all ages with Intellectual and Developmental disabilities, creating new opportunities for Living, Loving, Working, and Learning. We are looking for enthusiastic and energetic Assistant Supervisor to work with this active group of people, who has the ability to handle challenging situations with patience and understanding.

**Mission Statement YAI:** 

YAI is a network of agencies offering people with intellectual and developmental disabilities a comprehensive range of services across all ages. YAI empowers people with disabilities to reach their goals every day. Our enthusiastic staff of over 4,000 professionals believes that everyone has a fundamental right to live, love, work, and learn. If you share our vision and want to help support people to live the fullest lives possible, apply to this position.

**Location**: Rockland County, NY

**Schedule**: Full-Time

Tuesday: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm

Wednesday: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

Thursday: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

Friday: 12:00 pm - 8:00 p

Saturday: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm

**Key responsibilities**:

- Ensuring the health, safety, and habilitation of the people we support is consistent with agency philosophy and department practice

- Ensuring the appropriate, therapeutically documented level of supervision in the residence, day program or community to ensure and protect the health and/or safety of the people we support.

- Providing program/floor coverage.

- Promoting and maintaining the excellence of our programs

- Involving family members and other stake holders, including professionals, in the team process

- Keeping staff informed by attending meeting and delivering “the message” consistently

- Fostering professional development through regular supervision, training, and evaluations

- Supervising staff to ensure that they meet the needs of the people we support, agency standards, and develop professionally through the supervisory process. - Bringing the organizational culture to life

- Ensuring a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination - Actively participate in the hiring process

- Maintaining direct relationship with staff - Building staff morale

- Utilizing participatory management

- Fostering the Open-Door Policy

- Nurturing staff development Supervising/Managing teams

- Maintaining oversight and compliance of systems specific to role and responsibilities

- Fostering communication between relevant supports including those within the program, within the agency, and supports outside the agency.

- Required to perform your responsibilities as they currently exist or may change in meeting the needs of the department, under the supervision of your supervisor/manager.

**Education and Experience:** 

- High School Diploma or GED - Some College Preferred

- Prior Direct Support Professional experience preferred

- Background in supporting people with intellectual/developmental disabilities or mental health preferred

**Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**:

- Interpersonal and problem-solving skills

- Well-developed writing skills

- The ability to accept and apply feedback

- Highly flexible personality type

- Valid Driver's License preferred depending on location

- Flexibility adjusting your schedule to meet programmatic needs

- Proficient in Microsoft Office

- Ability to learn/use Workforce Management software to effectively carry out essential business processes

**Compensation:** 

$22.00/hr.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Driver's License (Required)

* Nanuet, NY (Required)

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
About Us

Established in 2003, Reddy Care Physical and Occupational Therapy has been featured on the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest growing companies in the country for the past four years and counting. Our physical therapist owned private practice offers stability and growth for every employee. We not only bring talented people together but collaboratively take courses to team build and invest in our employees professional development.

From the very first day, our employees are given personalized onboarding, modern work spaces and the most up to date technology to create an ideal staff/patient interaction. We strive to foster an enthusiastic and productive company culture so our Physical Therapy team can provide effective client care aimed at attaining improved clinical results.

Our vision is to continue to establish outpatient facilities, in-home therapy and courtesy transportation. Our goal is to expand our company to a national platform to revolutionize the way patients access outpatient therapy.

The Opportunity

Reddy Care Physical and Occupational Therapy is hiring a part-time Physical Therapy Aide for our Farmingdale, NY outpatient facility. This position is an excellent opportunity for students or recent college graduates looking to expand their knowledge of the physical therapy and healthcare field.

What you will be doing:

Greeting patients when they arrive at the facility

Assisting therapists to administer exercise programs as needed

Interacting with patients to promote a friendly and positive atmosphere

Maintaining the general organization of the clinic.

Prepares hot and cold packs.

Maintains and cleans the treating tables.

Assist with patient flow within the facility as per the direction of the Physical Therapist, Occupational Therapist or Physical Therapist Assistant.

Other duties as assigned.

What you will need:

* Strong interest in the physical therapy or medical field.
* Patient-first mentality.
* Good interpersonal/communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Self-starter.
* High school diploma/GED
* Must be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* May spend long periods of time stooping, kneeling or crouching.
* Students in Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy or Physical Therapist Assistant programs are strongly preferred.

Reddy Care Physical Therapy is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Guest Relations Associate- Eataly Flatiron
description:
**Company Description**  

Eataly is the world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace! Eataly is not a chain; each Eataly is different, with its own character and own theme – but all with the same aim... for our guests to:

* EAT authentic Italian food at our restaurants, cafés and to-go counters
* SHOP a selection of high-quality Italian, local and homemade products
* LEARN through our classes and our team’s product knowledge

  

**Job Description**  

A Guest Relations Associate is also known as the Education & Events Associate. The Guest Relations Associate engages with guests by sharing knowledge about Eataly, its products and history. They are responsible for providing exceptional guest service and directly influencing guest impressions at Eataly by way of greeting, directing, and answering inquiries over the phone and in person. Reports to the Education & Events Manager.

* Provides exemplary guest service to all internal and external Eataly guests
* Communicates effectively to customers and staff in person, through email, and over the phone

* Collects payments from guests and issues store credits, comps, and refunds with Management discretion

* Prepares and executes product tastings and demonstrations and assists with in-store events and activations

* Ability to remain calm and patient in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to learn, retain and share Eataly knowledge

* Previous retail and/or restaurant experience preferred
* Ability to speak and understand Italian preferred

title: Phlebotomist - Part Time
description:
This is a Part Time position: Monday - Thursday, 3pm - 7pm and every Saturday, 8am - 12pm

**Essential Job functions**:

* Uses appropriate aseptic technique to draw blood cultures.
* Processes Stat specimens according to Summit Health SOP.
* Prepares collection containers with appropriate preservatives for patients and gives instructions for proper collection of specimens at home (Urine & Stool). Properly measures and records a volume for a 24-hr collection.
* Properly collects a COC Urine Drug Screen.
* Properly administers and collects a H. pylori Breath test.
* Properly handles orders on minors.
* Uses the correct procedure for completing paperwork and labeling of specimen for OVH Blood Bank specimens.
* Processes satellite specimens and delivers them to the appropriate department.
* Monitors inventory levels and follows appropriate protocol for replenishing supplies in phlebotomy room and storage area.
* Deletes/cancels orders as necessary with full documentation of reason. Ensures proper patient charge deletion according to departmental policy.
* Recalls patients for follow-up procedures or error correction as required. Documents callbacks in the lab logbook.
* Utilizes LIS for all applicable functions to perform job duties, including downtime procedures.
* Adapts work schedule to meet emergency staffing needs.
* Required Competencies:
* Demonstrates competency in all areas of adult phlebotomy\\*
* Demonstrates competency in all areas of pediatric phlebotomy\\*
* Demonstrates competency in all areas of infant phlebotomy\\*
* Demonstrates competency in performing skin punctures\\*
* Demonstrates competency in performing bleeding times including entering the result in the LIS and the logbook.
* \\*Includes: Correct Order of Draw for multiple tube collection, using good judgment in evaluating specimens using established protocol, and demonstrating application of an adequate bandage to puncture site with explanation of puncture site care to patient.

**General Job functions:**

* Properly check-in a patient in a satellite lab, including arriving the patient on the day-list.
* Properly process lab and office collected specimens for transport to the main lab by courier.
* Contact a courier for a Stat pickup in a satellite office.
* Properly perform, log, and enter a result for a Rapid Strep and or Hemoccult test in the LIS. Notifies physician of critical (positive) result.
* Trains new staff in proper lab policies and procedures.
* Other job duties as required.

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking)

**Environmental Risks:**

* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative Patients / Visitors

**Blood-borne Pathogens:**

* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens is possible.
* Unplanned or unexpected exposure.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:** 

* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Minimum of 2 years of phlebotomy experience required and drug screen collection preferred.
* Has the ability to perform all testing required at our satellite locations.
* Phlebotomy Technician Certification through the National Health Career Association (NHA) preferred; may be required for specific locations based on operational needs.
* CLA Certificate preferred.
* Knowledge of medical terminology, HIPAA guidelines and laboratory requirements to include skills in phlebotomy techniques with adult, pediatric, and geriatric patients, computer/data entry skills and phone etiquette are required.
* Attention to detail, ability to critically think, multitask, and maintain accuracy during periods of frequent interruptions in a fast-paced environment.
* Consistently demonstrate the ability to communicate in a clear and effective manner and read/follow procedures accurately.

**Travel:**

* Travel to satellite locations as needed.

Job Type: Part-time

Benefits:

* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid sick time
* Paid training

Schedule:

* Every weekend
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* working as a Phlebotomist: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Phlebotomy Technician (Preferred)

title: RESIDENTIAL MANAGER (OPWDD)
description:
To provide overall supervision/oversight for residential units to ensure that the program is operated within regulatory and agency guidelines. To provide supervision and guidance to Direct Support Professionals; to ensure that staff are trained in accordance with OPWDD and agency regulations. To ensure that individual treatment plans are implemented.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop activities in and outside of the house.

Ensure consumer diet and nutrition in all aspects i.e., menu plans, weight records etc.

Monitoring consumer’s health through contact with physicians, dentists, and other treatment personnel

Ensures Consumer’s program plans are followed.

Responsible for hiring, training, evaluating and in conjunction with Director, terminating of staff for the house.

Responsible for supervision of all staff

description:
Are you interested in taking your next career step with an industry leader? Do you have exceptional organizational skills? Do you work well independently as well as a part of a team? We have just the opportunity for you! We are a leading home services provider and due to our continued growth, we are looking for a highly skilled and reliable individual to work as an Administrative Coordinator.

**Responsibilities:** 

As an Administrative Coordinator, you will be responsible for supporting the office with administrative tasks as well as ensuring compliance of district and company policies.

**Specific duties include:**

* Post documents as needed for State, Federal, Company and District compliance as needed
* Process required Accounts Payable documents for Accounting
* Reconcile vendor statements, research, and resolve any discrepancies
* Petty cash control, reconciliation and preparation of petty cash reports
* Process check requests
* Track monthly postage usage for internal departments
* Assist with organizing in-coming and out-going mail/shipments
* Order stationery and office supplies
* Assist with contract renewal pricing
* Assist walk-in customers with inquiries and process any payments given
* Other duties as assigned

**Requirements:** 

As an Administrative Coordinator, you must be professional, pleasant and possesses the ability to function equally well in both a team environment and independently. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and active listening skills, along with the ability to interact effectively with both customers and coworkers.

**Specific qualifications include:**

* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* 2 or more years of office experience preferred
* 1-2 years in a customer-facing role; prior experience in a customer service setting preferred
* Strong troubleshooting abilities
* Excellent telephone skills
* Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
* Proficient in MS Office Suite, MS Outlook, and Web navigation

**Benefits:**

As an Administrative Coordinator, you will be part of an evolving organization that built its reputation on providing our customers with the best possible service. Our employees are, of course, one of the main keys to our continued success and so, we are committed to your professional development. As we continue to grow, you may find opportunities for advancement to roles of greater responsibility with us.

Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:

* Medical coverage (F/T staff)

* Plus more!

***Build a rewarding career with an industry leader!***

***Apply now!***

title: CAD Operator
description:
**Position Summary**

We are seeking a **Cad Operator** with 2+ years of experience to work in the expanding Transportation group. The CAD Operator will work on a variety of public sector infrastructure projects in the NY/NJ area including bridge, roadway, and aviation projects. Work includes preparation of contract drawings in AutoCAD and MicroStation. The CAD Operator would work on numerous assignments and work with multiple Project Managers.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Prepare design plans under the direction of a Project Manager or Design Engineer.
* Assist with other elements of design submissions, such as estimates, technical specifications, details, and other project related documents.
* Coordinate with staff from a range of other disciplines (civil, structural, operations, etc.) to assist in resolving design issues.
* As a small firm, there are great opportunities to work on a variety of projects and learn different aspects of Civil and Traffic Engineering.

**Qualifications Desired**

* Knowledge of AutoCAD and MicroStation
* Experience working with and familiar with CAD Standards for Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, New York State Department of Transportation, or other local NY/NJ agencies
* Familiarity of FHWA MUTCD, AASHTO, State DOT, and other NY/NJ local standards
* Experience with ProjectWise
* Uncompromising Integrity
* Excellent teamwork, communication and people skills a must.
* Have a solid time management system and demonstrate excellent organizational skills.

**Who We Are**

Enovate is an Engineering firm that specializes in Transportation Engineering, Construction Management, and Monitoring. Since its inception, Enovate was able to position its brand as a leading WBE engineering/CM firm in the NY and NJ market. We have teamed with and supported well-known Engineering and CM firms and worked on flagship projects in both the public and private sectors. Our diverse team consists of Professional Engineers, Construction Managers, Technicians from varied backgrounds – design, project management and construction.

This is an opportunity to work with Enovate as we expand to meet the demand of this wide range of services and excel in a traditional industry that is ever changing with the adoption of technology.

Learn more at *www.enovateengineering.com*.

**Pay/Benefits**

Enovate has great benefits for our full-time employees. We provide medical, dental and vision on the first day of your employment. Life insurance, 401(k) matching plan, wellness programs and many other optional programs are offered as well.

Enovate is an equal opportunity employer.
