title: Medical Assistant
description:
Title: Medical Assistant

Location: Upper East Side

Org Unit:

Work Days:

Exemption Status: Non-Exempt

Salary Range: $25.11 - $26.59

\\*As required under NYC Human Rights Law Int 1208-2018 - Salary range for this role when Hired for NYC Offices

Position Summary

Under direct supervision and in accordance with established policies and procedures, assists with planning, implementing and evaluating patient care.This role is also responsible for the smooth function of patient flow.

Job Responsibilities

* Answers phones, responds to inquiries and triages calls to appropriate personnel.
* Greets registered patients at time of visit and triages patients through the patient flow process. Checks schedules and accompanies patients to exam/procedure room. Assists patients as needed with walking, transfers, dressing and preparing for exam.
* Responsible for maintaining a sterile environment. Ensures standard infection control precautions are observed.
* Prepares exam rooms prior to patient visit. Cleans rooms and instruments and re-stocks supplies between patients.
* Fulfills patient care responsibilities which may include, taking vital signs, updating patient history, collecting blood, urine and stool specimens and assisting providers/nurses in the exam room. Inputs patient data into the practice management system.
* Fulfills clerical responsibilities which may include, sending/receiving/scanning medical records, obtaining diagnostic reports, hospital notes & referral information, completing forms/requisitions, managing the charting process & sending specimens to labs.
* Monitors and ensures clinical equipment is functioning properly. Escalates issues to supervisor.
* Regularly checks dated materials and medications for expiration date and discards expired items.

Education

* High School Diploma

Experience

Approximately 1 year of related experience, preferably in relevant specialty area.

Completion of a medical assistant training course that includes phlebotomy training is highly desired.

Candidates with extensive medical assistant work experience, along with phlebotomy experience, may be considered.

If required to draw blood, proper phlebotomy training is required prior to performing those duties.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

* Demonstrated strong communication and interpersonal skills; demonstrated ability to interact with multiple constituencies and exercise "people skills".
* Demonstrates ability to exercise standards of professionalism, including appearance, presentation and demeanor.

Licenses and Certifications

Working Conditions/Physical Demands

Weill Cornell Medicine is a comprehensive academic medical center that is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery, and the education of future physicians and scientists in New York City and around the world. Our doctors and scientists - faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and the Weill Cornell Physician Organization - are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Our medical practices serve communities throughout New York City, and our faculty provide comprehensive care at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Brooklyn Methodist Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Westchester Behavioral Health Center, and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. At Weill Cornell Medicine, we work together to treat each individual, not just their conditions or illnesses, as we strive to deliver the finest possible care for our patients - the center of everything we do. Weill Cornell Medicine is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Weill Cornell Medicine provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

title: Health and Benefits Account Manager
description:
Health and Benefits Account Manager

About Us

We provide clients with a customized roadmap and guide them through the employee benefit challenges of today and tomorrow. We Offer a Dedicated Client Relationship Manager serving as your point of contact for employee benefits ̶ and as an additional resource for your employees.Our team of experienced advisors craft a benefit program to maximize what you offer while minimizing costs.

We strive for every interaction to be driven by our core values, what we call the benefEx CHOIR; specifically, **C\\*uriosity,** H**onesty,** O**wnership,** I**ndependence, and** R\\*esourcefulness.

About the Role

As a **Health and Benefits Account Manager,** you will play a critical role in enhancing our clients' health and benefits programs. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining strong client relationships, providing strategic guidance, and ensuring the seamless implementation and management of benefits plans. Your will help clients navigate the complexities of benefits management, optimize their offerings, and maintain compliance with relevant regulations. This role requires a blend of strategic thinking, excellent communication skills, and a thorough knowledge of the health and benefits landscape.

Key Responsibilities

* Service a book of assigned clients, managing their health and welfare benefit programs for strong client retention.
* Manage the annual renewal process for benefits plans.
* Oversee the implementation of new benefits programs, ensuring a smooth transition for clients and their employees.
* New Business Onboarding: Tracks approval, final rates, and final enrollment results. Responsible for keying client information and rates / results into systems in a timely manner.
* Take inquiries from clients on a wide variety of issues and provide solutions through insurance and employee benefit expertise, research of plan documents and/or consultation with carriers.
* Resolve billing issues, claims issues, deduction issues and other client concerns.
* Perform associated tasks, including entry of demographic data.
* Review new client information and prepare payroll deductions and other enrollment reports for the client.
* Gather necessary data on clients at renewal time to request alternative / competitive proposals from other carriers.
* Identify opportunities for other Employee Benefit Services and Insurance products (i.e., P.O.P. / / FSA programs) and ancillary products (i.e., Life / AD&D, Dental, Vision, Disability)

Knowledge, Skills and Experience

* High School Diploma / GED required; college degree preferred
* Currently Licensed for Life Accident and Health in NJ preferred
* Previous experience in benefits administration and client management
* Possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Comfortable with phone calls and in person interaction with clients and service providers
* Easily adapt to new technologies, including Agency Management Systems and web-based platforms
* Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office
* Work well independently and within a team environment
* Ability to multi-task and remain organized in a fast-paced, changing environment

title: OPTOMETRIC TECHNICIAN
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Optometric Technician to join our team. As an Optometric Technician, you will play a crucial role in assisting the optometrist in providing exceptional eye care services to our patients. Your responsibilities will include performing various diagnostic tests, maintaining patient records, and providing support during eye exams. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of anatomy and physiology, excellent customer service skills, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:  
- Perform preliminary tests and measurements on patients, including visual acuity, color vision, depth perception, and peripheral vision  
- Conduct diagnostic tests such as tonometry (eye pressure measurement), visual field testing, and retinal imaging  
- Assist with contact lens fittings and teach patients proper insertion, removal, and care techniques  
- Prepare examination rooms and ensure all equipment is clean and properly functioning  
- Document patient history, symptoms, and test results accurately in electronic medical records (EMR) system  
- Educate patients on proper eye care practices and answer any questions they may have  
- Provide support to the optometrist during eye exams by conducting pre-testing procedures  
- Assist with frame selection and educate patients on lens options based on their prescription needs  
- Process orders for eyeglasses or contact lenses and ensure accurate delivery to patients

Qualifications:  
- High school diploma or equivalent required; additional certification or training as an Optometric Technician is preferred  
- Strong knowledge of anatomy and physiology related to the eye  
- Familiarity with medical terminology used in optometry  
- Proficiency in using electronic medical records (EMR) systems, preferably Epic  
- Excellent customer service skills with the ability to communicate effectively with patients of all ages  
- Basic math skills for retail sales transactions  
- Ability to perform vital signs measurements accurately  
- Prior experience in sales or retail is a plus

We offer competitive pay based on experience and qualifications, along with opportunities for career growth and advancement. Join our team and make a difference in the lives of our patients!

Note: This is a paid position, as all positions must be compensated, including internships.

title: Low-Level Performance C++ Developer
description:
We have immediate openings for Low-Level Performance C++ Developers. We’re building the next generation of capital markets technology. Global capital markets are an ocean of fast-moving, interrelated and complex data. We are looking for passionate and enthusiastic problem-solvers with an interest in capital markets data to join us as we continue providing technology innovation and support to the world’s leading global capital markets companies.
Current strategic pursuits
In this role, you will be part of a talented and open-minded software team that works on mission-critical applications within capital markets technology. You will have the opportunity to contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle – from suggesting the use of emerging technologies to designing, integrating, and upgrading complex architecture.
We’re looking for outstanding Low-Level Performance C++ Developers to grow our platform’s functionality across asset classes, data sets, and business verticals. Developers on our team have the rare opportunity to work on challenging and important problems as they transform high-quality raw data into actionable insight.
Duties include* Benchmarking – Develop reliable benchmarking tests and identify areas for improvement.
* Problem solve – Use code and hardware to solve challenging problems that affect a wide range of capital markets players.
* Collaborate- Interact with adjacent business functions including sales, product development, and client support.
* New technology – Work with state-of-the-art hardware (top-line CPUs, NVMe, Solarflare, ExaNIC).
* Research – Explore and implement new C++, OS, and hardware features.


Work qualifications* Excellent C++ skills.
* Significant experience with low-level programming and performance benchmarking.
* Experience with network programming and familiarity with Wireshark, tcpdump and similar tools.
* Excellent problem solving, coding and design skills.
* Ability to design, develop, and implement efficient code.
* Superb communication skills.


Compensation/Benefits Information (New York applicants only):
LSEG is committed to offering competitive Compensation and Benefits. The anticipated base salary for this position is $114,400 - $212,600.
Please be aware base salary ranges may vary by geographic location, city and state. In addition to our offered base salary, this role is eligible for our Annual Incentive Plan (AIP/”bonus plan”). Target AIP rates will be commensurate with role level and posted career stage. Individual salary will be reflective of job related knowledge, skills and equivalent experience. LSEG roles (excluding internships and part-time roles of less than 20 hours per week) are typically eligible for inclusion in our LSEG Benefits program, which includes offerings of: Annual Wellness Allowance, Paid time-off, Medical, Dental, Vision, Flex Spending & Health Savings Options, Prescription Drug plan, 401(K) Savings Plan and Company match. LSEG’s Benefits plan also includes basic life insurance, disability benefits, emergency backup dependent care, adoption assistance commuter assistance etc.
LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.
Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject.
If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

title: Manager, Business Development (Law)
description:
The GLG Law Business Development Manager will work with the team to address our law firm clients' expert witness needs. Managers are responsible for primarily phone-based outreach and relationship development, while working alongside members of Client Solutions teams to drive opportunities start to finish, culminating with increased adoption and usage of GLG's services across national and global client accounts. We take pride that attorneys from the world's top law firms, consultancies and government agencies find us when they need the very best experts for consulting work, high-stakes litigation, and business development needs. We relentlessly build our relationships and brand awareness through thoughtful outreach and client development. There's no script here; we each have our own unique selling style and embrace it. We're all dedicated to delivering an exceptional experience for our clients and have the requisite communication skills and polish to do so.



Our team is looking for enthusiastic and driven managers to join the Law Business Development team. Our clients are some of the busiest and most sophisticated professionals in the world. The role requires the confidence to contact associates and partners at leading law firms and leading government and enforcement lawyers, and the tenacity to repeatedly follow up to sell our services and win the business.


**Specific responsibilities include (but are not limited to):**


* Full-cycle sales – including but not limited to sourcing leads, performing various types of outreach, and pitching GLG's business model
* Create and manage phone and email campaigns to connect with existing and prospective users
* Partnering with senior members of the Client Solutions team to develop and deliver nuanced expert solutions for GLG's law firm and in-house counsel clients
* Developing and maintaining knowledge of legal market, as well as the macro business environment, disseminating relevant content to the rest of the team as appropriate
* Collaborating with colleagues on and across teams to build and shape the business
* Building account plans and setting account growth objectives.
* Obtaining in-person (or virtual) meetings existing and prospective users across the organization to obtain strategic information about the client, provide updates on GLG offerings and drive client-wide adoption of GLG Law
* Contributing to and where appropriate spearheading key strategic initiatives established by GLG leadership
* Business Development Managers may also, depending on experience, interest, and team need, be placed in a position of management over entry level Business Development Associates in a supervisory and people leader capacity.


**An ideal candidate will:**


* Act with the highest integrity and professionalism in all endeavors;
* Think creatively and focus on opportunities for growth;
* Exhibit relentless attention to detail;
* Practice excellent time management and prioritization skills;
* Possess a strong desire to work in a team; and
* Demonstrate the ability and initiative to handle increasing responsibility over time.
* 3+ years of professional sales experience is required, preferably in law or professional services


**For this specific position, the following factors will strengthen an applicant's candidacy:**


* Bachelors or higher degree (or equivalent work experience)
* Superior communication skills, including oral, written, and presentation abilities
* Confidence in making outbound cold calls
* Receptive to coaching and feedback
* Demonstrated commitment, judgment, emotional maturity, and intensity, ideally in a fast-paced, multi-task-oriented environment
* Strong problem-solving skills and hustle attitude
* Comfortable using PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Salesforce experience is a plus, but not required
* Entrepreneurial zeal and deep desire to build a business
* Understanding, awareness and/or interest in the legal industry but not a necessary prerequisite

**About GLG / Gerson Lehrman Group**



GLG is the world's insight network. Our clients rely on GLG's global team to connect with powerful insight across fields from our network of approximately 1 million experts (and the hundreds of new experts we recruit every day).



We serve thousands of the world's best businesses, from Fortune 500 corporations to leading technology companies to professional services firms and financial institutions. We connect our clients to the world's largest and most varied source of first-hand expertise, including executives, scientists, academics, former public-sector leaders, and the foremost subject matter specialists.



GLG's industry-leading compliance framework allows clients to learn in a structured, auditable, and transparent way, consistent with their own internal compliance obligations and the highest professional ethical standards. Our compliance standards are a major competitive differentiator and key component of the company's culture.



To learn more, visit www.GLGinsights.com.



Gerson Lehrman Group, Inc. ("GLG") is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, race, religion, color, marital status, disability, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Job Summary:**

Are you looking for a job that offers meaningful work? Are you looking for a culture where you feel valued and can call your workplace "home?" If you answered yes, then we have the job for you!

Our Registered Nurse are the heart of our business. Without you, we couldn't improve the lives of our seniors with everyday needs, put a smile on their face or be the highlight of their day! It is hard to put a price on helping others, but we know how important **you** are and value you provide our clients. This is an excellent opportunity for a dedicated healthcare professional to make a meaningful difference in the lives of patients.

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Competitive salary
* 24/7 office staff support
* A great working culture
* On-the-job training for unique client situations
* Paid travel in between clients and pad mileage.

Duties:

title: Medical Scribe
description:
CityMD is the go-to neighborhood urgent care for whenever life happens. Sometimes great care can’t wait, so CityMD has convenient locations that are open 7 days a week, 365 days a year. From visits with our board-certified doctors to rapid lab tests, patients can always expect quick and quality care. And if patients need a follow-up for primary or specialty care, CityMD can refer them to the exceptional doctors at Summit Health, whose providers are part of our connected care team, or to providers in their community. CityMD has 150+ locations in the New York and New Jersey metropolitan area. To learn more, check out citymd.com.

**Job Description**

A Medical Scribe is responsible for relieving a physician of their clerical duties, thereby allowing a physician to focus their attention on providing the best care to the patient. They are responsible for locating and obtaining a patient's medical history, documenting dictated notes during a patient visit on the Electronic Medical Record (EMR), facilitating diagnostic test, all while providing unparalleled customer service to our patients.

**\\*This is a great opportunity for those interested in CNA, MA, EMT, or Paramedic careers**  
**\\* Great exposure to the healthcare profession (excellent resume builder for medical school or PA school)**

**Essential Functions/Responsibilities**

* Ability to maintain quick pace in fast paced urgent care facility for duration of scheduled shift (8-12 hours except for meals/break time)
* Facilitating any necessary diagnostic tests (e.g., CT, MRI, ultrasounds, etc.) and referrals to medical specialists for follow-up care via Aftercare
* Providing compassionate care to our patients
* Assisting the physician with basic patient care and medical procedures set-ups
* Communicating with patients, pharmacies, and physicians over the phone under physician guidance
* Helping maintain a clean, courteous, and professional working environment
* Assist with training and acclimation of new hire scribes

**Qualifications**

* A High School Degree or GED
* Friendly and professional with excellent bedside manner
* Computer and typing skills are required - minimum of 45 wpm
* Flexible with full-time work schedule including weekends
* Passion for helping others in an urgent care environment
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
* High attention to detail and being able to work in a team environment
* Experience in any service industry a plus
* Must exhibit passion for outstanding results and compassion for those we work with and serve
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on site location.

**Physical Requirements**  
The job may require at times to lift light to moderate amounts of weight (e.g., boxes of medical/facility supplies) to assist team members. Job also requires ability to maintain a quick pace in fast paced urgent care medical facility for duration of scheduled shift minus meal/break time. Heavy computer use required.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $18.25 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: People Operations Coordinator
description:
**About Prove**
===============



As the world moves to a mobile-first economy, businesses need to modernize how they acquire, engage with and enable consumers. Prove’s phone-centric identity tokenization and passive cryptographic authentication solutions reduce friction, enhance security and privacy across all digital channels, and accelerate revenues while reducing operating expenses and fraud losses. Over 1,000 enterprise customers use Prove’s platform to process 20 billion customer requests annually across industries, including banking, lending, healthcare, gaming, crypto, e-commerce, marketplaces, and payments. For the latest updates from Prove,



Prove is driving the future of digital identity. We are looking for Provers who know how to make an impact. We’re talking self-starting professionals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, process information quickly, and make intelligent decisions. The work is challenging and requires not only smart but natural curiosity and tenacity. Teamwork is also important to us – we work together and play together.



Prove has big plans, and we’re excited about the future. If this sounds like the place for you – come join our team!



**Title:** People Operations Coordinator


**Department:** People


**Reports To:** Manager, Compensation and Benefits


**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt


**Location:** Denver, CO or New York, NY

  


**Position Summary**



As a People Team Coordinator (Human Resources Coordinator), you will play an integral part in delivering operational excellence. The successful candidate will be responsible and accountable for core employee lifecycle transactions from Hire to Retire, with a primary focus on Benefits. You will be viewed as the subject matter expert on benefits, leave of absences, HR processes, use of HR systems, and HR Policies.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Provide transactional support to the organization as it relates to employee matters.
* Administer employee benefits programs in accordance with federal, state, and local laws and regulations
* Manages the day-to-day processing of benefits which includes onboarding, terminations, and partnering with our third party administrator to coordinate leave of absence
* Serve as liaison for benefit vendors, reviewing vendor site portals, and maintaining updates
* Reconcile and validate monthly invoices for accuracy and send to A/P for processing
* Support international benefits, invoices, and reconciliation
* Lead employee communications and promotions for benefits through email, presentations, utilizing the People section on the Intranet, and updating our external website as appropriate.
* Coordinate special projects and events throughout the year including all phases of Open Enrollment
* General Employee Support: Respond to incoming inquiries through ticketing system. Escalate as needed and bring to resolution in a timely manner.
* Onboarding: Partner closely with Recruitment team to ensure a smooth onboarding experience for the new hire as it related to systems and documentation. Assist in following up as needed to ensure all required information is received in a timely manner and entered accurately.
* Job Changes: Partner across People Operations team to ensure timely system updates as needed for the movement of employees into new positions, locations, or managers. Ensure all aspects of the change, including documentation are addressed and accurately reflected in all HR systems.
* Respond to and resolve increasingly complex, sensitive, and confidential issues.
* Identify and recommend methods to update, simplify and enhance processes, procedures.
* Act in a consultative and project management role to support definition and implementation of People programs
* Lead and/or Support special projects as needed
* Promote, maintain and enhance our cultural values of humility, passion, inclusion, and leadership.
* Strong passion for learning about our products and markets through in-house and external training.


**Qualifications and Experience:**


* Strong passion for data excellence and drive to maintain data integrity
* Strong Excel Skills / Strong Google Sheets experience
* Bachelor's Degree preferred, or years of experience in Human Resources environment
* 1-3 years of experience in HR related area
* Strong problem solving and analytical ability.
* Understanding of HR programs relative to support of business objectives.
* Experience working in fast paced, changing environments with multiple priorities
* Inspires trust and has the ability to gauge the atmosphere and culture of the overall organization.
* Ability to work effectively in an environment of change and manage multiple priorities concurrently through strong project management, systems knowledge, and effective communication.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to independently compose routine written communications.
* Excellent proficiency in English (read, write, and speak) required.
* Strong customer service skills needed with positive demeanor in handling all inquiries.
* Promote, maintain and enhance our cultural values of humility, passion, inclusion, and leadership.
* Strong passion for learning about our products and markets through in-house and external training.
* Experience in cybersecurity, fintech, or fast-growing startup is required
* Experience in a high-growth tech startup growing from $50m to $200m in ARR


This position description should not be considered the final description of the position. The position description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the positions. It should be assumed that we would, to some extent, structure responsibilities in accordance with the successful candidate’s capabilities and changing business conditions. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.



The anticipated salary range for this role is $65,000 - $75,000 plus company bonus. Offered salary will be determined by the applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, geo-location and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.


**Benefits & Perks for FTE Provers:**


* Competitive salaries & Bonus Plan (for eligible roles) and Equity Plan
* 401(k) Retirement (Pension) Plan & Match
* Comprehensive medical benefits for you and your family
* Emotional & Physical Wellness – Access to wellness services (EAP, Gympass, Prove Well-Being Reimbursement)
* Unlimited Vacation and Flexible hours
* Bottomless snacks & beverages for all office locations
* $15 daily GrubHub stipend for lunch if coming into the office.
* A great place to work and connect with other talented Provers like yourself!

  

  

**Privacy & Data Protection**



When you are applying for a job at Prove, we collect and use your personal information in the job application process. To understand more about how Prove uses your personal information, please see our Recruitment Privacy Policy on our website.


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Prove we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

This position description should not be considered the final description of the position. It should be assumed that we would, to some extent, structure responsibilities in accordance with the successful candidate’s capabilities and changing business conditions.

*Prove is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people regardless of race, color, religion, gender or sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, veteran status or other personal characteristics.*

title: Medical Receptionist
description:
**Medical Receptionist**

Evolve Brain Health is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive individual to join our growing team as a medical receptionist.

**The Company**

As a company, Evolve Brain Health leads the way in innovative approaches to treating mental health issues. Led by Dr. Thomas Knightly, a clinical associate professor at the world-renowned Brain Stimulation Lab at Stanford University, we are uniquely positioned to be early-adopters of the latest technologies to enhance the long-term well-being of our patients. Joining us means being part of a modern mental health practice that prioritizes innovation and top-notch patient care. We foster a supportive and cooperative workplace that emphasizes professional advancement, ongoing learning, and personal development.

**The Opportunity**

We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive individual to join our growing team as a medical receptionist. This unique position will be pivotal in overseeing the daily operations of our practice, ensuring smooth front desk and back office functions. As our practice continues to grow, this role has the potential to evolve into a leadership position with responsibilities that include managing front desk staff.

**Responsibilities**

* **Front Desk Operations:** Oversee daily front desk activities including patient check-in/check-out, scheduling appointments, managing patient records, and handling inquiries with professionalism and empathy.
* **Back Office Management:** Supervise and coordinate back office tasks such as managing prior authorization requests, facilitating medication requests, and maintaining medical records.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with clinical staff and administration to ensure seamless communication and coordination across the practice.
* **Process Improvement:** Identify opportunities for operational improvements and implement best practices to enhance patient experience and streamline workflow.

**Qualifications**

* **Experience:** Multiple years of experience in medical front desk or back office roles, with a demonstrated understanding of healthcare operations.
* **Skills:** Strong organizational and multitasking abilities, excellent communication skills, and a high level of professionalism.
* **Problem solving:** Proactive approach to problem-solving and operational efficiency.

**Position & Schedule Type**

* Type: Full Time, In-person
* Hours: Schedule will be discussed during the interview process.
* Location: Stamford, CT

**Compensation**

Expected compensation for this position is highly competitive at $20-$25 per hour. Additionally, this position is eligible for benefits (subject to eligibility requirements) listed here: medical, dental, vision, 401(k), PTO, and company holidays to name a few.

**Advantages of working with Evolve Brain Health**

* **Growth Opportunities:** Be part of a dynamic and expanding practice with the potential for career advancement and professional development.
* **Innovative Treatments:** The opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art mental health practice that values innovation and excellence in patient care.
* **Supportive Environment:** Work in a collaborative setting where your contributions are valued and your growth is encouraged.
* **Impactful Work:** Play a crucial role in delivering high-quality mental health care and making a difference in our patients' lives.
* **Compensation:** Competitive compensation package, including benefits
* **Culture:** Strong company culture which places an emphasis on work/life balance

**Website:**

* Evolvebrainhealth.com

**Application Instructions:**

To express interest in this role, please email your CV to Dr. Tom Knightly at tknightly@evolvebrainhealth.com

title: Installer
description:
CLC is looking to hire an installer with a carpentry background that we can train to be long-term part of our company installing library shelving and furniture.

The starting salary for this position is $55,000 per year. However, there also will be an opportunity to work on multiple prevailing wage projects throughout the year. This will raise the annual compensation to at least $65,000-$70,000 per year, and this can grow over time. There is also an opportunity to earn an annual bonus.

Our clients are located in NJ, NY, CT, MA, and other locations, so there will be overnight travel 50-75% of the time as part of this position. The company of course covers all travel costs.

Our Installation Lead will train you in how to receive deliveries, install shelving, furniture and custom millwork, and manage relationships with our clients and end users.

The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic, willingness to be on the road in multiple states throughout the week, and a carpentry background. You will install steel shelving and furniture, while working with our clients and manufacturers to address concerns and implement fixes.

A carpentry background is important because much of our work is wood shelving, furniture, service desks and casework. These items often need to be cut, modified and/or scribed to address field conditions. We will teach you not just how to receive and install products, but how to problem-solve issues in the field.

· Travel job sites (libraries or schools) to receive, unload and inside-deliver product.

· Install library shelving and furniture according to CLC and manufacturer best practices.

· Make product modifications and/or fixes in the field as required.

· Coordinate with CLC office on delivery of forklifts, dumpsters, etc. to job sites.

· Make early visits to job sites for field measurements and surveying of existing conditions.

· Basic carpentry experience - understanding how to cut, scribe, sand, touch-up, etc.

· Driver’s License

· Strong work ethic

· Willingness to be away from home during the week for out-of-state installations

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $55,000.00 per year

* Paid time off

title: Pest Control Technician
description:
**About the Position:** Braman Termite & Pest Elimination is seeking qualified Pest Control Technicians to join our growing team. Here at Braman we are committed to properly training and keeping our technicians up to date on the latest advancements in the industry. We are looking for ambitious individuals ready to begin a fascinating career path filled with opportunities for growth and advancement. Our technicians will go through a thorough on the job training program with an experienced technician. Additionally, Braman offers a full certification program with support from a board-certified entomologist to complete their required state testing and obtain the proper credentials. Company vehicle is provided.  

  

**Duties & Responsibilities:**
* Determining the kind of treatment required to eliminate a particular type of pest.
* Advising customers on the kind of treatment required to eliminate identified pests.
* Inspecting customers’ premises to identify pest problems.
* Filling out all necessary paperwork upon completion of each job.
* Communicating with office staff in order to schedule services with customers.
* Applying suitable pesticides to infested areas by following the label instructions and complying with safety procedures.
* Responding to customers’ requests for various pest control services.
* Identifying opportunities to sell additional company services and products.
* Adjusting chemical mixtures according to the size of the infested areas.

**Physical Demands:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  

The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 50 pounds. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to:
* Sit
* Stand
* Squat
* Walk
* Use hands to finger, handle, or feel.
* Reach with hands and arms.
* Climb and balance.
* Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
* Talk and hear.
* Enter/exit structures and crawl spaces.
* Travel up and down stairs.
* Climb a ladder.
* Use required personal protective equipment.
* Visually inspect for pests, pest harborage, and pest entries.
* Drive a vehicle.
**Skills, Experience and Educational Requirements:**
* High school diploma or GED.
* Valid driver’s license.
* We perform criminal background checks, motor vehicle record checks and drug screening.
* The ability to work in all weather conditions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication skills.
* Exceptional customer service skills.
* Detail-oriented.
**Benefits:**
* Competitive wages based on prior pest control experience
* Quarterly bonus incentive program
* 401K retirement plan- With company match!
* Health, dental, vision and supplemental insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Company paid life insurance
* Paid vacation, holidays and sick time
* Weekly paycheck
* Opportunities for commission
* Company uniforms
* Company vehicle and phone (once certification is complete)
* Paid Technical Training School/Required State Pesticide Licensing

  

  

  

**Why Braman?** Founded in 1890 Braman is a growing third-generation family owned company that cares about its employees. Braman is the largest pest control company in the Northeast serving both residential and commercial customers that prides itself on our well-trained service professionals and commitment to maintaining strong relationships with our customers. We use generations of experience to provide the best service possible.
company_description: Braman strives to protect the public health, property and environment by providing honest, quality pest control service.

title: Executive Medical Director
company: New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
description:
**Executive Medical Director, Bureau of Public Health Clinics**

* DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE
* Full-time
* https://cityjobs.nyc.gov/job/executive-medical-director-bureau-of-public-health-clinics-in-queens-jid-23678

Location

QUEENS

* No exam required

Department

Medical Services

**Salary range:**$88,437.00 – $185,000.00**Job Description**

Established in 1805, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (the NYC Health Department) is the oldest and largest health department in the country. Our mission is to protect and improve the health of all New Yorkers, in service of a vision of a city in which all New Yorkers can realize their full health potential, regardless of who they are, how old they are, where they are from, or where they live.

As a world-renowned public health agency with a history of building transformative public health programming and infrastructure, innovating in science and scholarship to advance public health knowledge, and responding to urgent public health crises from New York City’s yellow fever outbreak in 1822, to the COVID-19 pandemic we are a hub for public health innovation, expertise, and programs, and services. We serve as the population health strategist, and policy, and planning authority for the City of New York, while also having a vast impact on national and international public policy, including programs and services focused on food and nutrition, anti-tobacco support, chronic disease prevention, HIV/AIDS treatment, family and child health, environmental health, mental health, and racial and social justice work, among others.

Our Agency’s five strategic priorities, building off a recently-completed strategic planning process emerging from the COVID-19 emergency, are:  
1) To re-envision how the Health Department prepares for and responds to health emergencies, with a focus on building a “response-ready” organization, with faster decision-making, transparent public communications, and stronger surveillance and bridges to healthcare systems 2) Address and prevent chronic and diet-related disease, including addressing rising rates of childhood obesity and the impact of diabetes, and transforming our food systems to improve nutrition and enhance access to healthy foods  
3) Address the second pandemic of mental illness including: reducing overdose deaths, strengthening our youth mental health systems, and supporting people with serious mental illness  
4) Reduce black maternal mortality and make New York a model city for women’s health  
5) Mobilize against and combat the health impacts of climate change

Our 7,000-plus team members bring extraordinary diversity to the work of public health. True to our value of equity as a foundational element of all of our work, and a critical foundation to achieving population health impact in New York City, the NYC Health Department has been a leader in recognizing and dismantling racism’s impacts on the health of New Yorkers and beyond. In 2021, the NYC Board of Health declared racism as a public health crisis. With commitment to advance anti-racist public health practices that dismantle systems that perpetuate inequitable power, opportunity and access, the NYC Health Department continues to work in and with communities and community organizations to increase their access to health services and decrease avoidable health outcomes.

PROGRAM AND JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Bureau of Public Health Clinics (BPHC) seeks to hire an Executive Medical Director to oversee its medical affairs for the Sexual Health, Tuberculosis, and Immunization clinics.

The mission of the Bureau of Public Health Clinics is to promote a healthy community by providing New Yorkers with the resources needed to make informed and empowered health decisions; identify and treat tuberculosis and provide immunization and sexual health services regardless of ability to pay or immigration status. It is also the Bureau's vision to provide timely, accessible, high-quality, equitable and respectful care that helps improve the lives of our patients and contributes to a healthier community.

We strongly encourage people to apply and contribute your diversity in thought, racial identity, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability status, veteran status, and/or LGBTQI+ status to enhance the work of the DOHMH and promote the health of all New Yorkers.

We welcome applicants who share the vision for a city where all New Yorkers can realize their full health potential, regardless of who they are, where they are from or where they live. DOHMH extends this vision of wellness by providing every member of our team and prospective job applicants dynamic benefits: Benefits - NYC Health, and a robust Worksite Wellness program with a wide range of offerings.

As a current or prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. Please review the notice to see if you may be eligible for programs and how to apply at nyc.gov/studentloans

DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:

Oversee the development and direction of BPHC medical services through a public health lens, centering increased access to care and health equity for BPHC patients.

Establish, implement, and evaluate standards for practice management and patient satisfaction/experience; Maintain the organization's medical policies and procedures consistent with guidelines established by NYCDOHMH, NYSDOH, Article 28/NYS, CDC, HRSA/340b, and relevant MCO guidelines.

Develop and maintain clinical protocols and procedures; communicate all protocols and procedures to BPHC staff through trainings, written memos, participation in planning meetings.

Communicate with regulatory agencies and their representatives to maintain an understanding of regulations and care standards.

Assess candidates for employment, coordinate of onboarding, orientation, ongoing in-services, training, supervision, evaluation, and discipline for clinicians. Actively partner with the Human Resources Department and the CMO on these activities.

Perform routine electronic medical records audits for proper, timely documentation and standards of care.

In collaboration with ED of Clin Ops, Director of Program Implementation, and other members of leadership team, actively engage in the planning, development, monitoring and evaluation of public health programs within BPHC clinics.

Provide clinical care in BPHC clinics for a minimum of 28 hours per month; provide on call after hours and participate in emergency preparedness activities and response as assigned.

Facilitate environment for professional development of clinicians through development and sharing of scientific research, publications, continuous training.

Provide content and protocol training to staff on new or modified clinic initiatives in collaboration with other members of BPHC leadership.

Ensure that resources are used efficiently, and that provider staffing maximizes their contribution to meeting patient, clinic, and fiscal goals of the organization.

\\*\\*IMPORTANT NOTES TO ALL CANDIDATES:

Please note: If you are called for an interview you will be required to bring to your interview copies of original documentation, such as:  
- A document that establishes identity for employment eligibility, such as: A Valid U.S. Passport, Permanent Resident Card/Green Card, or Driver’s license.

title: Director of Human Resources
description:
Thank you for your interest in joining the National Ramp team!

National Ramp is a market leader, innovator, and disruptor providing newfound freedom to elderly and disabled human beings with the greatest range of accessibility ramps in the industry. Our family has been in the access business for over 30 years, and the foundation of our growth and any success we’ve had is our Core Value to care about people.

National Ramp dealers have installed hundreds of thousands of ramps across North America, and it is truly rewarding to make a real and meaningful change in so many lives. We believe that making great ramps is only a part of our work. The greatest work we do is giving fellow humans their freedom back. When someone is literally trapped inside their home or stuck in a hospital and we are able to provide a means for them to regain their Freedom Now – that is what brings us true joy and purpose.

At National Ramp, we work hard, we are accountable, and we are results-driven. We recognize that these attributes may not be valued by everyone, and that’s OK!

Our Core Values are:

* **We WOW** – We go the Extra Mile. We exceed expectations. We work hard and have fun. We are obsessed with our customers, we love our business, and we love what we do. We are “World Class” in everything we do.
* **We NOW** – We GSD (Get Stuff Done) and we get it done fast. Freedom NOW. We are urgent, driven, energetic, and fast-paced. We believe in “production, then perfection”.
* **We Own It** – We are accountable. No excuses, no jerks. We take responsibility for our actions, our job, our life, and our word by seeing things through to completion. We are nice, but we are driven for results.
* **We Innovate and disrupt.** We are growth-minded, for us and for our customers. We never stop learning. We adapt quickly and thrive on new challenges. We constantly seek ways to disrupt the status quo and improve.
* **We Care**. We care about people. About each other, about our customers, about our customer’s customers, about our families, and about the world. We are invested in National Ramp and behave like it’s our own business to help everyone win. We stay safe to ensure everyone goes home the way they came, every day.

Today, National Ramp is in search of a passionate and enthusiastic **Director of Human Resources** who will bring their expertise to our team and help us grow to become the #1 Ramp Company in the World.

**Key Attributes We Admire:**

* Confidence and determination
* Ability to build rapport across diverse personality types
* Active listening skills to truly understand and address customer needs
* Persistence and creativity in problem-solving

**Summary:**

This individual will have a wide array of HR related responsibilities, with a strong emphasis on recruiting. This individual would report on-site to the Rockland County, NY headquarters. This is a great opportunity for anyone looking for a long-term home with a company that helps veterans, the disabled, and the elderly!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Recruitment, candidate selection, and the onboarding process
* Managing a company’s candidate evaluation process
* Ensuring that the company’s procedures comply with employment regulations
* Monitoring various aspects of employee performance, such as attendance and sick leave
* Designing and implementing training programs based on assessed needs
* Handling any disciplinary processes and formal grievances
* Setting and reviewing pay structures and employee perks and benefits
* Maintaining employee benefits programs including annual health insurance renewals, competitive leveling and employee communication
* Manage HR employees
* Manage Staffing Agency/Recruiter relationships
* Perform any other related duties as required or assigned
* Prepare FMLA paperwork as needed
* Ensure legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state requirements
* Maintain management guidelines by preparing, updating, and recommending human resource policies and procedures
* Maintain organization staff by establishing a recruiting, testing, and interviewing program; counseling managers on candidate selection; conducting and analyzing exit interviews; recommending changes
* Ensure the processing of new hires, temporary workers, promotions and terminations is accurate and timely

**Qualifications:**

* 3-7+ years in Human Resources
* Human Resources certification preferred
* Proven ability to recruit successfully using all major recruiting platforms – LinkedIn, Indeed, etc.
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to listen and effectively verbalize ideas
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate staff
* A solid understanding of the key principles of employment law
* The ability to remain calm in stressful situations including during disciplinary hearings or staff conflicts
* Solid ethics and morals and sound judgment
* Associate or Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, Psychology, or related preferred
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
* Proficient with MS Office applications (Outlook/Word/Excel)
* Excellent customer service skills with the ability to maintain a positive, professional demeanor
* Possess strong organizational, time management, and interpersonal skills
* Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy
* Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality
* Must be a team player

**Location:** Valley Cottage, NY (On-Site)

The salary range for this position, based in Valley Cottage, NY, is $150,000 to $200,000 per year. The final salary will be based on the candidate's qualifications and experience.

title: Medical Receptionist
description:
**Essential Job functions**:

* Greets visitors, patients, and families in a friendly professional manner and directs them appropriately.
* Maintains an efficient patient flow through the registration process and provides excellent customer service to patients/families.
* Promptly answers the telephone, directs all calls appropriately, takes an accurate message and delivers to the appropriate individual/demonstrates appropriate etiquette.
* Informs patients of delay in physician schedules, assists with patient comfort while delayed.
* Posts all self pay charges, collects payments, and provides patient with receipt. Accurately reconciles daily payments. Reconciles billing slips to daily schedule.
* Opens and closes batches properly, accurately reconciles collections, prepares deposits and documents corrections.
* Scans the insurance card, processes insurance verifications utilizing the on-line system, and updates the patient account. Updates patient information including demographics, insurance, HIPAA forms and financial waivers.
* Schedules appointments accurately according to department guidelines; using waitlist when applicable. Confirms future appointments as needed. Review Eligibility and Phone report.
* Schedules and enters orders for diagnostic tests, and procedures, following all appropriate workflows.
* Works cooperatively with Patient Care Resources and clinical staff to ensure timely pre-authorizations.
* Completes referrals according to departmental guidelines and properly enters into the appropriate system.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns, or issues to the Office Supervisor / Manager appropriately and promptly.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* High School Graduate or GED required. Associate Degree preferred.
* Bilingual-Spanish speaking preferred.
* Heartsaver within 30 days of hire.
* Previous PSR experience preferred.
* Must have the ability to organize and perform multiple tasks in a timely manner.
* Knowledge of medical office and terminology preferred.
* Basic proficiency in computer use required. Previous experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Experience with EHR, Practice Management System and Departmental/Ancillary Systems preferred.

**Travel**:

* Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed.

title: Head of Compliance, US Operations
company: The Bank of East Asia, Limited
description:
**## Job Summary**

The Bank of East Asia, Limited, New York Branch is currently seeking a Head of Compliance to join its US Compliance team. The Head of Compliance is responsible for the Compliance function of the Bank’s New York and Los Angeles Branches (“the US Operations”) and serves as a second line of defense in managing compliance risk. The position is responsible for ensuring the US Operations are in compliance with applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Community Reinvestment Act (CRA), Privacy, California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), and the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) regulations. The Head of Compliance must ensure that effective controls are in place to mitigate compliance risk, including drafting and implementing adequate policies and procedures in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. In addition to the above, the Head of Compliance also provides professional opinions to the Management of US Operations and Head Office (“HO”) on all Compliance-related matters of the US Operations, including but not limited to providing independent feedback and recommending a course of actions should any ad-hoc Compliance issue arises.

**## Responsibilities**

- Develop and implement compliance policies and procedures in compliance with applicable regulatory requirements.

- Conduct GAP analysis between US and Hong Kong regulatory requirements, including Head Office policies and guidelines, to ensure compliance with the highest standard.

- Conduct ongoing compliance monitoring and reviews to ensure the bank is in compliance with its regulatory obligations and that any deficiencies are corrected promptly.

- Perform risk assessments and recommend appropriate corrective actions to resolve any identified compliance program deficiencies.

- Develop an annual compliance plan to schedule the activities of the Compliance Department.

- Develop, conduct, and recommend compliance related trainings to staff.

- Assess the compliance implications of new products and services and the adequacy of management’s measures to ensure compliance in the delivery of such services.

- Assess communications with the public, including product advertising, to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

- Implement appropriate systems for timely detection and reporting of suspicious activities to the relevant government authorities, including identified cases of money laundering, fraud, terrorist financing, BSA violations, sanctions evasion, and other financial crimes.

- Perform a second level review on BSA alerts to ensure compliance and record keeping.

- Chair the compliance and BSA/AML/OFAC management committees and ensure reporting of high level risks.

- Review and report substantiated regulatory breaches and regulatory non-compliance incidents.

- Responsible for managing the Compliance Department staff in US Operations and conducting their annual staff performance appraisals.

**## Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree (BA) from a university in law, business management or related discipline.

- 10 years + experience in risk management or compliance management roles

- ACAMS certification required

- Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software

- Excellent communication, leadership, organizational, detail, analytical and decision-making skills.

- Experience and substantial knowledge of industry protocols, best practices, and all applicable regulatory requirements, including the Bank Secrecy Act, OFAC, and other consumer regulations

- Strong negotiation / influential skills and must be able to interact with auditors and regulators

- Ability to effectively manage sensitive situations and confidential data with a strong moral code and sense of ethics

- Ability to collaborate with other departments and all levels of associates

- Excellent time and project management skills

title: Shop Technician
description:
**EquipmentShare is Hiring a Shop Technician**
----------------------------------------------


#### **EquipmentShare is searching for a Shop Technician in Elizabeth, NJ.**


**About EquipmentShare**
------------------------



EquipmentShare is dedicated to creating a **connected jobsite for the modern contractor**. We deliver user-friendly technology solutions that help contractors maximize their equipment uptime, reduce risk exposure and increase productivity. EquipmentShare's product offerings include an improved equipment rental experience, fleet tracking and asset management software, hardware security solutions and predictive service and maintenance applications.



EquipmentShare is the fastest-growing, independently owned construction equipment rental company in the country. We serve dozens of markets across the U.S. and are on track to create a national footprint in every major market in the country by the end of 2023.



EquipmentShare's rapid growth goes beyond meeting a demand for equipment rentals in booming new markets. Instead, our mission *begins* with our rental product, and it's a testimony to our ability to improve industry standards and better serve the customer. **Our expansion and customer retention is a validation of strong contractor demand for the smart jobsite technology we've built into our rental fleet.** And it's just the beginning of our journey to establishing a global presence.


**Your Opportunity to Grow with Us**
------------------------------------

  


The EquipmentShare team is a close-knit group of professionals who all share an interest in providing a service and product that improve our customer's experience. Above all, we care about building something people want, and the only way to do that is by assembling a skilled, passionate and talented team. Our mission is to improve productivity and efficiency throughout the entire construction industry, and our people are how we make achieving that goal possible.


**We're seeking a Shop Technician who loves a challenge and wants the opportunity to grow with a fast-paced company. Industry competitors often have layers of tenured management that create barriers to career advancement. The opportunity for career growth is unparalleled at EquipmentShare, where you'll find no shortage of challenging yet fulfilling work, chances to build new skills and supportive teammates who will push you to achieve your best.**


**Shop Technician** will provide maintenance and repair for a variety of customer- and company-owned heavy equipment machinery and aerial lifts. You'll document service, perform functionality and safety tests, and spend a great amount of time working one-on-one with our customers. You should have super strong electrical and hydraulic knowledge, plus experience reading and understanding electrical schematics. Our tech should:


* Champion safe job practices for repairing equipment
* Use technology (laptops and tablets) comfortably
* Be eager and able to fix nearly any piece of equipment
* Enjoy working directly with customers to solve their problems
* Work well in a team environment and communicate effectively
* Be knowledgeable of OSHA requirements (preferred)

**About You**
-------------

Our mission to change an entire industry is a grand mission, so we only hire people who are up to take on this massive challenge with us. In turn, our employees have every opportunity to make a tangible difference at work and succeed. We want employees who are energized by challenge instead of turning away from it.


**What You're Working With:**

* You can lift a maximum amount of 50 lbs.
* You can stoop, bend, climb and crawl without restrictions
* At least three years of experience in field service, maintenance and repair
* High school diploma or trade school certificate
* Valid driver's license

**Why We're a Better Place to Work**
------------------------------------


* Competitive salary
* For Field Technicians, a service truck outfitted with everything you need to get the job done
* Paid holidays
* Health insurance and medical coverage benefits, with eligibility on your first day of work
* 401(k)
* Volunteering and local charity initiatives that help you nurture and grow the communities you call home through EquipmentCare
* With us, you get a chance to be a part of a growing startup's success and build the foundation for our future


**Since our founding in 2015, we've had explosive growth—and we're not stopping anytime soon. Ready to invest in our mission, invest in yourself and discover a better place to work? Then we'd love to meet you. Apply today.**

  



EquipmentShare is an EOE M/F/D/V
company_description: EquipmentShare is a construction technology solutions provider devoted to developing ways for the modern-day contractor to get more done.

title: Associate, Equity Research (Healthcare)
description:
**About Clear Street:**



Clear Street is building financial infrastructure for today's institutions. Founded in 2018, Clear Street is an independent, non-bank prime broker replacing the legacy infrastructure used across capital markets.



We started from scratch by building a completely cloud-native clearing and custody system designed for today's complex, global market. Clear Street's proprietary prime brokerage platform adds significant efficiency to the market, while focusing on minimizing risk and cost for clients. Our goal is to create a single source-of-truth platform for every asset class, in every country, and in any currency.



By combining highly-skilled product and engineering talent with seasoned finance professionals, we're building the essentials to compete in today's fast-paced markets.

  


**The Role:**



Clear Street is seeking equity research associates to join our dynamic equity research team covering mid- and small-cap biotech companies. We are looking for associates to work with senior Analysts in the healthcare sector. The candidate's responsibilities will include:


* conducting proprietary research on companies in the biotechnology sector
* sector-specific research, including understanding preclinical and clinical data and


drug approval process  

* writing equity research publications
* maintaining financial models

  


**Qualifications & Skills:**



The ideal candidate should possess the following skills and attributes:


* Previous experience of fundamental equity research experience including financial statements analysis experience, and financial modeling skills is preferred
* Bachelor's degree required, advanced medical or scientific degree a plus
* Financial modeling skills a plus
* If not already licensed, candidates be required to pass FINRA SIE, Series 63, Series 86, and Series 87 exams
* Proficiency in Excel and Powerpoint
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate ideas and investment theses
* Detail oriented, self-motivated and hard working
* Ability to work on a team
* Occasional travel may be required

  


**We offer:**



The base salary range for this role is $85,000-150,000. The range is representative of the starting base salary for this role at Clear Street. Which range a candidate fits into and where a candidate falls in the range will be based on job related factors such as relevant experience, skills, and location. These ranges represent Base Salary only, which is just one element of Clear Street's total compensation. The ranges stated do not include other factors of total compensation such as bonuses or equity.



At Clear Street, we offer competitive compensation packages, company equity, 401k matching, gender neutral parental leave, and full medical, dental and vision insurance. Our belief has always been that we are better as a business when we are all together in person. As such, beginning on January 2, 2023, we are requiring employees to be in the office 4 days per week. In-office benefits include lunch stipends, fully stocked kitchens, happy hours, a great location, and amazing views.



Our top priority is our people. We're continuously investing in a culture that promotes collaboration. We help each other through challenges and celebrate each other's successes. We believe that modern workplaces succeed by virtue of having high-performance workforces that are diverse — in ideas, in cultures, and in experiences. We put in the effort to make such a workplace a daily reality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Security Guard
description:
**Mission Statement:** *Empowered by God's love, rooted in the Gospel of Jesus, faithful to the vision of one sacred Earth community, we live and work to bring all into union with God and one another.*

 **POSITION SUMMARY:**

  

As a Security Guard you will be responsible for ensuring the safety and security of our personnel, and Sisters. You will conduct patrols, monitor for security breaches, respond to emergencies, and maintain a vigilant presence to deter unauthorized access. We are currently recruiting a weekend overnight shift.

 **QUALIFICATIONS:**


 Proven experience as a security guard or related field preferred.


 Strong observational skills and attention to detail.


 Ability to respond calmly and effectively in emergency situations.


 Good written and verbal communication skills; ability to prepare clear and concise reports.


 Integrity and professionalism, maintaining confidentiality and adhering to ethical standards.


 Valid state driver's license and clean driving record (if applicable).

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**


 Perform security patrols of designated areas.


 Identify and report conditions that may pose security concerns or safety hazards.


 Respond promptly to emergencies, alarms, and calls for assistance.


 Contact and coordinate with emergency services (police, fire, medical) as needed.


 Monitor premises to detect unauthorized persons and prevent vandalism or theft.


 Investigate incidents, accidents, and suspicious activities; prepare detailed reports.


 Conduct inspections of emergency and safety equipment; ensure readiness and functionality.


 Assist with obtaining parking permits and ensuring compliance with parking regulations.


 Perform additional duties and tasks as assigned by the Director of Security.


 Flexibility to work shifts other than assigned when necessary, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

 **Work Environment**


The role involves both indoor and outdoor work, with exposure to various weather conditions.


May require standing, walking, or patrolling for designated periods of time.


Occasional lifting or moving of equipment may be required.

 **Physical Demands**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this role. While performing the duties of this role, the employee is regularly required to speak and listen; use hands and fingers to manipulate objects. The physical demands include, but are not limited to, standing, sitting, walking, lifting, carrying, reaching, handling, kneeling, crouching, and bending.

  

The Sisters of Saint Joseph provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristics protected by federal state or local laws.
