title: Care Manager for Transition of Care (Social Worker Level III- LCSW), MPA BH Administration
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

Care Transition social workers provide care transition interventions to patients and their families transitioning from an inpatient admission or ED visit back to the community. Care transition social workers help patients remain engaged in behavioral health care and primary care, coordinate supportive services, and help patients overcome barriers to managing health conditions.

General tasks and responsibilities will include:

* Engaging/enrolling patients into the program, typically at the time of an inpatient admission or ED visit
* Conducting community-based assessments and interviews to identify patient health goals and needs
* Linking patients to community-based social support programs
* Assessing and addressing health, social and service-related needs of assigned/identified patients and create individualized, patient-centered, goal-directed plans for each patient
* Supporting and motivating patients to achieve their health goals by coaching them through behavior change and identifying their strengths and community support systems
* Helping patients connect to a primary care provider, specialty care providers, community services and/or mental health services, attend medical appointments, and fill prescriptions
* Assessing ability of patients to manage their chronic behavioral health condition(s) and work with care team to connect them to appropriate education and monitoring programs
* Assisting patients with social needs such as food insecurity, housing issues, legal needs, insurance or other health care coverage, or transportation and provide referrals and follow-ups, as needed (for example, helping patients fill out benefit applications)
* Educating patients regarding available community services, health services, and patient rights; provide feedback from patients to NYC H+H to inform quality improvement efforts
* Collecting and tracking data to support achievement of patient-centered care plan using assessment tools, surveys, and logs, as appropriate
* Documenting each patient encounter in the electronic medical record (Epic) and use other electronic systems (e.g., NowPow) in accordance with established policies and procedures
* Attending regular team meetings to discuss patient progress and update care plans; communicate with patients’ behavioral health and primary care providers
* Perform other, related program tasks, as needed and perform duties in response to public health emergencies, when necessary

Minimum Qualifications

Valid license as an LCSW issued by the NYSED.

Department Preferences

KNOWLEDGEABLE IN:

* Communities served by NYC Health + Hospitals
* Community resources and levels of behavioral healthcare
* Social Determinants of Health

PREFERRED SKILLS:

* Prior experience in Care Transition or Care Management in a health care and/or Managed Care setting strongly preferred
* Confident, autonomous, solution driven, detail oriented, high standards of excellence, nonjudgmental, diplomatic, resourceful, intuitive, dedicated, resilient and proactive
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills including motivational coaching, influencing and negotiation abilities
* Bilingual is a plus
* Cultural competency
* Ability to communicate empathy

YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:

* Two years of full-time, paid, professional experience providing direct client care in a behavioral health setting
* Prior experience in Care Management in a health care and/or Managed Care setting strongly preferred

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

License/Certification:

* NYS LCSW (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: 6th Grade History Teacher 2024 - 2025 School Year
description:
**Beginning with Children**

Beginning with Children (BwC) is a Brooklyn based school management organization founded by school reform leaders Joe and Carol Reich over 20 years ago on a deep belief in the power of education. BwC supports two New York City Public Charter Schools and an alumni and college success program that provides education and academic supports for students from Pre-K to college.

Our schools, **Beginning with Children Charter School 2** and Community Partnership Charter School,\\*\\*are located in Bedford Stuyvesant, Clinton Hill and Williamsburg where approximately 90% of our families qualify for free/reduced lunch. Our hard-working families, face high rates of low-wage employment, and find it increasingly difficult to break the cycle of poverty and continuing injustice which plague these neighborhoods. At BwC we know that academic success and college completion have proven to be the most effective way to promote social and economic mobility. We are committed to creating strong centers of learning that transform the lives of students and families and revitalize communities.

Beginning with Children continues to successfully move K-8 graduates through high school graduation and college enrollment. The success of BwC Scholars is the product of caring, committed and talented educators who work collaboratively with families to meet the needs of our students. As we continue to develop our Professional Learning Community we invite talented and innovative educators to join us in our mission to provide quality instruction to every child in every classroom.

**Our Schools**

Beginning with Children schools empower scholars to meet high academic standards throughout their education and embrace a set of core values that are essential to success in life. Our graduates will be independent thinkers who are committed to succeeding in college preparatory programs and becoming active and engaged citizens in their communities.

**BwCCS2 Mission**

BwCCS 2, Middle School is a nurturing community that fosters a love of learning and the development of character for students in 6th-8th grade. Our students achieve academic excellence and are prepared to succeed in top performing high schools and colleges. BwCCS 2 students develop and use G.R.I.T. (Good Judgment, Resilience, Integrity, and Teamwork) for personal and community improvement.

**Open Positions:**

* **6th Grade History Teacher**

**Responsibilities:**

* Support students' academic and socio-emotional development
* Set student performance and growth goals and work to achieve those goals
* Collaborate with leadership to implement the School's mission and goals
* Align the core curriculum with Common Core State Standards.
* Participate in the implementation of systems to assess student achievement.
* Model the school's mission, values and standards for professional behavior.
* Perform other related duties as required and assigned

**Qualifications:**

* New York State certification (preferred)
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Strong interpersonal skills.
* Ability to communicate effectively with diverse constituencies, including students, parents, trustees, BwC representatives, community members, and donors.
* Understand the nuances of urban school environments and school culture.
* Experience teaching middle school.
* Master's degree.
* Minimum 1 year teaching experience.
* Experience teaching English as a Second Language or Speech is a plus
* Bilingual (Spanish) a plus.

**Personal Characteristics**:

*The successful candidate will be*:

* Passionate about providing high quality education to students in an underserved urban community.
* Relentless in his/her drive to improve the minds and lives of the students in and out of school.
* Humble, reflective and willing to continually improve.
* A teacher with maturity, confidence, wisdom and collaborative skills necessary to garner the trust and confidence of board members, faculty, staff, students, parents, and others within the school community.
* An individual with a high level of integrity and work ethic who can inspire through example.
* An individual who promotes consistent standards of excellence in teaching and learning throughout the school.

title: Event Coordinator
description:
**Event Coordinator**

  


Chapin School hosts several events throughout the year, including Grandparents’ Day, Runathon, Curriculum Fair, Locker Day, Winter and Spring concerts, Show Choir, alumni events, various receptions, and more.


The Event Coordinator will be responsible for the logistics of each event. The Event Coordinator will be in attendance at each event and will serve as the point of contact for the details of each event. Due to the nature of the position, evening and weekend hours are required from time to time. A calendar of planned events will be provided, but flexibility is a must.


**Responsibilities**

  

* Support faculty and staff responsible for various events.
* Establish and maintain relationships with vendors and venues.
* Complete catering orders and building use forms.
* Manage set up and clean up of every event.
* Create, prepare, and print event-related materials, including invitations, programs, name tags, etc. as needed.
* Maintain and replenish, when necessary, an organized supply of event materials, including, but not limited to, signage, tablecloths, vases, paper products, etc.
* Plan and manage event details and aspects for a variety of school functions hosted by the Admission and Advancement Offices, and other school-wide events.
* Plan and manage all faculty and staff events, including, but not limited to, faculty meetings, the faculty holiday party, and the faculty end-of-the year party.
* Create reliable financial reports on each event.
* Be in attendance and manage every event and address any potential problems that arise at the event in real time.
* Maintain a working knowledge of the needs of a wide variety of events.
* Other duties as assigned.

  

**End-of-the School Year Events and Activities**

  

* Manage all aspects of all end of year events, including, but not limited to, Awards Day, Graduation, etc.
* Compile all photos and video for the End-of-the-Year Video, created by a professional videographer.

  

This is a 10-month position August 15 - June 15. The Event Coordinator reports directly to the Director of Advancement & Admissions.

title: Consulting, Consultant
description:
Deloitte Consulting LLP seeks a Consulting, Consultant in Morristown, New Jersey and various unanticipated Deloitte office locations and client sites nationally.

**Work You’ll Do**  

Provide software advisory and implementation services to help companies unlock the value of big technology investments as discrete services or comprehensive solutions. Help define systems strategy, develop system requirements, design, prototype, test custom technology solutions, and support system implementation. Research user reported issues with software systems, identify root causes and resolutions, implement fixes, and liaise between business functions, end users, and technical delivery teams. Provide industry insight and analytical support using data mining, pattern matching, data visualization, and predictive modeling tools to produce analyses and algorithms that help businesses make better decisions. Help manage the complexity inherent with technology change, from requirements planning to architecture, testing to deployment, and beyond, helping to link their IT programs to organizational goals. Drive operational efficiency by maintaining data ecosystems, sourcing analytical expertise, and providing offerings for continuous insights and improvements.  

  

* 50% Travel required nationally.
* Telecommuting permitted.
* Work location includes various unanticipated Deloitte office locations and client sites nationally.
**Requirements**  

Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Business Administration, any STEM field, or a related field. Must have 1 year of related work experience in the job offered or in a related occupation. Position requires 1 year of related work experience in each of the following:  

* Tracking implementation defects, coordinating defect resolution efforts, and documenting resolution details utilizing Atlassian Jira, Waterfall, and Agile Scrum;
* Creating technical and functional system requirements and use cases including screen layouts, navigation flows, logic diagrams, data models, and process models by leveraging Microsoft (MS) Visio, MS Word, MS Excel, Software AG ARIS, Atlassian Jira, and InVision;
* Designing, developing, testing, and implementing web-based application solutions across all phases of Agile Scrum, Waterfall, and LEAN Six Sigma project life cycle;
* Gathering functional and technical requirements, and analyzing and translating requirements into project designs to deliver solutions to meet clients’ needs by employing Atlassian Jira, Brainstorming, Prototyping, Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions, Stakeholder Interviews, Documentation Analysis, and Workshops;
* Designing data from relational databases including MYSQL and SQL Developer using Rational Database Management System (RDBMS), SQL, and PL/SQL;
* Tracking and reporting on project and milestone deliverables and statuses to ensure timely project delivery, and communicating updates to stakeholders through use of Atlassian Jira, MS Project, and MS PowerPoint;
* Analyzing and documenting current-state systems, processes, and environments to support project design of future-state and systems processes and environments using MS Visio, Software AG ARIS, SWOT Analysis, and GAP Analysis; and
* Performing User Acceptance Testing and Regression Testing utilizing HP ALM Quality Control (QC), to ensure successful design and implementation of project solutions.
**Other**  

Hours: M-F, 40 hours/week;


If offered employment, must have legal right to work in U.S. EOE, including disability/veterans.


**Recruiting tips**  

  

From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte.
**Benefits**  

  

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.
**Our people and culture**  

  

Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our client most complex challenges. This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work.
**Our purpose**  

Deloitte’s purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and in our communities. We are creating trust and confidence in a more equitable society. At Deloitte, purpose is synonymous with how we work every day. It defines who we are. We are focusing our collective efforts to advance sustainability, equity, and trust that come to life through our core commitments.
**Professional development**  

  

From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.
As used in this posting, "Deloitte" means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Customer Success Manager, Google Marketing Platform, Agency
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in advertising, consultative sales, business development, online media environment, or marketing role.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* 4 years of experience in marketing with Google Ads, Google Analytics, and third-party measurement and App platforms.
* Experience in video, display, app, and social advertising solutions.
* Experience in digital advertising sales, product marketing, or product/project management.
* Experience working for or with agencies.
* Ability to build customer relationships and present solutions.

**About the job**
-----------------


Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.



Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $101,000-$147,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Manage multiple complex projects simultaneously and coordinate internal resources across many functional areas to meet customer needs.
* Create learning agendas for client onboarding and ongoing enablement. Lead scaled training, work on product sessions, and account-specific activation sessions in partnership with Account Executives to drive business or platform/feature adoption and error mitigation.
* Drive features adoption to ensure Third-Party Cookie Deprecation readiness and platform stickiness.
* Build and maintain a strong knowledge of Google Marketing Platform product capabilities (with a focus on DV360 and CM360), how they integrate with one another and work with Google Cloud.
* Maintain relationships with agency clients, serve as a liaison, answer agency inbound questions, platforms usage and features and resolve technical roadblocks, and understand their challenges and needs in order to enable their success with our tools.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Supervisor, Internal and External, Capital Delivery Supervision
description:
**About us**
------------

**National Grid is hiring a Construction Supervisor for our Complex Construction Department in Melville, NY.** \\*This position covers the Downstate NY Region with work zones from Staten Island to Montauk Point. At this time, work is in the Long Island territory.


National Grid is one of the fastest growing utility companies with Safety as our core value. Winning several awards for ‘America's Best Employer for Diversity’, the company welcomes any talented leader who is interested to work for the gas construction department. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. This requires us to deliver on our promises, and to be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow.

**Job Purpose**
---------------


The Supervisor is responsible for the oversight and organization of assigned operations personnel and contractors. You will effectively ensure timely and cost-effective completion of Gas Capital Delivery projects while supporting the safety, reliability, and integrity of gas facilities in accordance with the company’s departmental, regulatory policies, and procedure requirements.


This position will supervise external Gas Contractor crews performing all aspects of related work to manage the local construction process to ensure safe operations are being performed for not only the contractor personnel but the public as well. Safety, Quality and Compliance are the key factors to ensuring we meet our corporate goals.

**Key Accountabilities**
------------------------

* Oversee and support the construction process in the field following the construction policies and procedures while maintaining a strong focus on workplace safety, through field inspection.
* Ensure the delivery of a successful project through leadership in the construction process while remaining fully compliant and within budgetary limitations, resulting in the timely and cost-effective installation of gas facilities
* Supervise a workforce that may work overtime hours (day/night). Must be available for standby assignments on a rotational basis, and respond to emergencies to ensure public safety
* Ensure that all work is performed in accordance with all federal, state, and local municipality regulations & guidelines, and Operator Qualifications
* Confirm accurate daily reporting of all field work
* Review daily reporting and System Operating Procedures of the job, work orders, construction sketches, Operator Qualifications of the crew, contractor onboarding, etc.
* Collaborate with wide range of diverse teams across industry, including government & local municipality officials
* Attend & participate in all field meetings including pre-construction meetings, safety meetings, and all daily job briefs
**Qualifications**
------------------

* A technical degree/bachelor’s degree in engineering/related area and/or equivalent experience is preferred
* 3 years of relevant experience in areas of utility operations, utility construction & operations or similar industry is preferred
* Committed to ‘on the job’ training programs with practical experience of methods, processes and techniques relevant to certification requirements with NGA Gas Operator Qualifications
* Knowledge of Federal, State, OSHA, local, and company safety & environmental rules and regulations & systems used in the Natural Gas Industry
* Requires knowledge of Microsoft products such as Excel, Word, Teams, Outlook, and PowerPoint. Primavera, PowerPlant and SAP experience is a plus.
* Understands procedures & standards and demonstrates the ability to provide directions with clear reason and rationale.
* Strong oral and written communications skills are required.
* Able to attend and test for Gas Operator Qualifications
* Maintains a non-restricted State issued driver’s license.
* Knowledge and ability to drive within New York City is required.
* Able to travel throughout service territories and willing to work extended hours when the job requires. That might include, but is not limited to, system emergencies. Driving to other company locations, including New England and Upstate NY, for various meetings and training.
**More Information**
--------------------


Salary


$109,000 - $128,000 a year


This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.
company_description: National Grid is one of the largest investor-owned energy companies in the US — serving more than 20 million people throughout New York and Massachusetts.

title: Quality Control Technician
description:
**Job Summary:**

The Quality Control Technician ensures that all internal requirements are met before our products reach our customers. This role is responsible for implementing written procedures, inspecting outputs, and identifying non-conformity issues. The position also involves monitoring quality control at the facility as directed by QC management.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with production staff to implement quality procedures.
* Maintain product specifications and quality standards as per the HACCP plan.
* Recommend corrective and preventive actions where needed.
* Ensure compliance with SQF standards and federal and state food safety regulations.
* Monitor labeling compliance.
* Perform quality control tasks and review/complete records daily.
* Monitor and uphold quality KPIs.
* Perform other related tasks as assigned.
* Maintain calibration and records of quality control equipment.
* Conduct inspections across all stages of production.
* Identify areas for quality control improvement and implement new methods accordingly.
* Communicate quality or compliance concerns with urgency to management.

**Qualifications and Education Requirements:**

* Minimum of 2 years’ experience in inspection and/or production.
* High School diploma or GED at a minimum.
* Results-driven with strong attention to detail.
* Demonstrated work ethic and integrity.
* Strong working knowledge of various mathematical concepts including fractions, ratios, and proportions.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Ability to analyze and interpret information and recommend corrective actions where needed.
* Ability to communicate in Spanish is a plus.
* Must be computer literate.

title: Employment Litigation Associate
description:
Employment Litigation Associate

Faruqi & Faruqi, LLP is a national law firm focused on complex civil litigation.

The Firm seeks an Associate with two (2) to six (6) years of experience to join the Employment Practice Group, Faruqi & Faruqi Manhattan office. The Group specializes in litigating discrimination/retaliation cases, as well as wage and hour class and collective actions. The Associate will conduct legal research, draft pleadings and various motions, respond to discovery demands, and assist senior associates and partners with all aspects of employment litigation.

Must Have Qualifications: JD from an ABA-accredited Law School. Admitted to practice law in the state of New York. Strong research and writing skills are required. Only resumes with GPAs will be considered.

Base compensation ranges from $135,000 to $165,000, commensurate with experience.

Faruqi & Faruqi, LLP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Pay: $135,000.00 - $165,000.00 per year

title: Caregiver
description:
Responsibilities:  
1. Provide assistance with activities of daily living (ADLs), including bathing, dressing, grooming, and toileting, based on the individualized care plan.

2. Assist with mobility, transfers, and exercises as prescribed by healthcare professionals.

3. Administer medication reminders and ensure adherence to prescribed treatment plans.

4. Perform light housekeeping tasks such as meal preparation, laundry, and maintaining a clean and safe environment.

5. Monitor and report changes in the client's physical and mental condition to the supervising nurse or healthcare professional.

6. Foster a positive and supportive atmosphere, promoting emotional well-being and companionship.

7. Accompany clients to medical appointments, shopping, and other activities as needed.

8. Document care activities accurately and maintain confidentiality of client information.

9. Collaborate with the healthcare team to ensure a holistic and coordinated approach to client care.

Qualifications:  
1. Certification as a Home Health Aide (HHA) or completion of a Personal Care Assistant (PCA) training program or willingness to obtain.

2. Previous experience in home healthcare or a related field is preferred.

3. Compassion, empathy, and a genuine interest in improving the lives of others.

4. Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

5. Ability to follow care plans and adapt to the unique needs of each client.

6. Reliable transportation and a valid driver's license, if required for home visits.

7. Ability to pass a background check and drug screening.

Benefits:

- Competitive salary

- Flexible scheduling

- Ongoing training and professional development

- Supportive work environment

- Opportunities for career advancement

title: Orthotic and Prosthetic Technician
description:
Are you looking for a career that offers personal and professional growth, flexibility, and a supportive environment? Look no further! Alba Medical Supply is an innovative organization committed to investing in our employees and providing the very best care to our patients.

At Alba Medical Supply our mission is to serve our community with the highest compassionate and innovative care! We are committed to building a Team of dedicated, caring, and responsible professionals, who prioritize patients’ well-being and exceptional care services. It is essential that our team members embrace and promote this mission every day in every way possible. Our Orthotist and Prosthetist is a crucial part of our mission with their primary responsibilities being to evaluate their patients’ condition and look for creative solutions to their rehabilitation needs.

**Responsibilities:**

* Evaluate and interview patients to determine their need;
* Fit, test, and evaluate devices on patients, and adjust for proper fit, function, and comfort.
* Instruct patient in the use and care of orthoses and prostheses.
* Assess patient needs applying knowledge of anatomy and kinesiology synthesizes and report assessment verbally and in writing.
* Design and modifies prosthetic and orthotic devices to meet patient requirements.
* Perform fitting and fabrication techniques of prosthetic and orthotic devices.
* Direct the work of Orthotics/Prosthetics Technicians, students, and volunteers.
* Participate in-service presentations to staff and students.
* Maintain inventory and orders materials.
* Assist with development and implementation of clinical programs
* Participate in interdisciplinary planning.
* Adjust, repair, or replace prosthetic or orthotic devices.
* Perform fitting including static and dynamic alignments.
* Maintain patient records
* Review the impact of wearing a new prostheses/orthosis and help patients to adjust to using their new devices.
* Train and supervise support staff, such as orthopedic and prosthetic assistants and technicians.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in Health Care Industry
* Completed Master’s degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics
* Graduate from an accredited Prosthetic-Orthotic Practitioner program and Eligible for certification by the American Board for Certification in Orthotics and Prosthetics
* NY ORTHOTIST or PROSTHETIST License

Why pick Alba Medical Supply for your next career move?

We offer:

title: Route Sales Representative (Mobile Sales Rep)
description:
**Company Description** *The targeted hiring range for this Route Sales Representative position is* ***$15.90 to $20.67 plus commission*** *depending on qualifications; however, the expanded salary range provides opportunities for advancement. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and job location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, competencies, experience, and relevant education, training or a combination of these things plus market demand. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and benefits for your location during the hiring process.*


You can find retail jobs just about anywhere. So, why work at Red Wing Shoes? From our purpose-built footwear to our stylishly designed stores, you’ll see the difference. From our life-friendly retail schedules to career advancement, you’ll feel the difference. And, when you create remarkable, in-store experiences for customers who build, shape, and protect the world around them - you’ll make a difference. We’re not just retail. We are Red Wing.

 **Job Description** **GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB:**


Promote and support our high-quality Red Wing brand image through professional selling, building loyalty and long-lasting relationships with our customers. This is achieved by promoting the Red Wing Shoe Company’s Ultimate Fit Experience (UFX), selling our premium products, and providing conscientious customer service.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Through an approved maintenance facility conduct routine maintenance schedules for the mobile unit
* Perform and maintain daily logbooks, travel tracking and mobile unit inspections as described by the Department of Transportation and Red Wing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
* Prepare, load, and unload stock to be placed on mobile unit and in warehouse for the day’s business
* Maintain proficiency with product knowledge, technical, and operating standards through continuous learning
* Adhere to all mobile operations as defined in each SOP
* Mobile Operating Expense: inventory, cash, truck maintenance, travel, and other areas that will directly affect the profitability of the mobile unit
* Guide each customer through RWSC’s Ultimate Fit Experience
* Provide appropriate accessory recommendation, educate customers on the benefits of each
* Ensure proper handling of special orders placed during the day’s truck run
* Collaborate with industrial team regarding planning and execution of the day’s truck runs

**OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Willingness to perform additional duties as required
* Maintain safe and healthy work environment by following organization standards and legal regulations
* Uphold Red Wing Shoe Company’s core values
* Maintain the integrity of the Mobile Shoe Showroom, truck signage, and housekeeping standards
* Conduct self-accordance to RWSC policies
* Identify current and future account requirements by establishing personal rapport with key contacts while onsite
* Ensure product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations

  

**Qualifications** **EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:**

* High School Diploma/GED (or equivalent work experience required), and one to three years relevant experience/training
* Enthusiasm, motivation to provide the highest level of customer service.
* Strategic thinking, planning, problem solving
* Team and collaboration orientation
* Effective Written/Verbal Communication
* Computer proficiency

**ADDITIONAL DESIRABLE QUALIFICATION AND COMPETENCIES:**

* Footwear selling experience from a mobile unit
* Retail footwear and/or wholesale experience
* Naturally curious, has passion for new ideas, and looks to drive growth
* Performance driven
* Learning orientation

**REQUIRED LICENSES, CERTIFICATES OR KNOWLEDGE:**

* Valid Driver’s License required
* Ability to pass and stay compliant with DOT requirements, which includes a DOT physical and drug screen**, and you must be 21 years old.**

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

* Lifting 50 pounds, bending/squatting to lace shoes, overhead lifting, twisting, climbing a ladder, standing for long periods of time
* Housekeeping duties including but not limited to: vacuuming, mopping & waxing floors, washing windows, use of disinfectant chemicals, discarding of all trash, maintaining recycling, installing, and maintaining furniture, fixtures, and displays.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**

* Driving or selling shoes from the truck
* Warehouse and Mobile Shoe Truck
* Retail store
* Outside
* Some overnight travel
* Extended travel time

  

**Additional Information** **Red Wing Shoes is an Equal Opportunity Employer****.**


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  

Individuals with disabilities needing assistance in completing an application may contact rwsc.recruitment@redwingshoes.com or call 651-388-8211.


Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP at https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm


All offers of employment are contingent on satisfactory results of a background check.


Red Wing Shoe Company, Inc. is a drug-free workplace.


Red Wing Shoe Company will not be using recruitment agencies or firms to fill this position and we will not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate information. No agency calls please.

Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Advance Practice Nurse PD
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare - Nursing
  

**Department** NJMS-Medicine-Tuberculosis Center
  

**Overview**
The mission of New Jersey Medical School is to educate students, physicians, and scientists to meet society’s current and future healthcare needs through patient-centered education; pioneering research; innovative clinical, rehabilitative and preventive care; and collaborative community outreach.”
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking an Advance Practice Nurse PD for NJMS- Medicine. The Advanced Practice Nurse-PD (APN) is responsible for screening, in accordance with the NJMS Global Tuberculosis Institute Lattimore Clinic policies and procedures and the Nursing Standards of Practice, provides leadership and clinical expertise in the assessment, planning, and treatment of patients in the Lattimore Clinic and additional State-funded clinic(s). Interacts in a collaborative fashion, under the direction of the Nurse Manager, with nursing and field staff to conduct patient TB training programs, research, and develop materials for physicians, nurses, and other relevant health care workers.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Performs patient assessment and physical examinations within prescribed guidelines and instruction of physician.
* Orders, interprets, and evaluates diagnostic test to identify and assess patient’s clinical problems and healthcare needs.
* Works collaboratively with physicians, nurses, social workers and other support services involved with the patient.
* Records finding and formulates a care plan based on patient’s condition.
* Teaches patient/significant others about health illness state and tuberculosis disease, infection, and medication.
* Discusses case with physician and other health professionals to prepare and individualized care plan based upon patient assessment and the medical plan of care.
* Refers patients to physician for consultation orto specialized health resources for treatment.

title: Mental Health Clinician III
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Mental Health Clinician III
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare
  

**Department** UBHC-Acute Treatment-NWK
  

**Overview**
Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care (UBHC), established in 1971, offers a full continuum of evidence based behavioral health and addiction services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors throughout New Jersey. UBHC’s 1,060 experienced behavioral health professionals and support staff are dedicated to treatment, prevention, and education. UBHC, one of the largest providers of behavioral health care in the country, has a budget of $260 million and has 15 sites throughout New Jersey. Services are readily accessible and include: inpatient, outpatient, partial hospitalization, screening, crisis stabilization, family/caregiver support, community outreach and case management, supportive housing, supported employment, prevention and consultation, employee assistance programs, and a licensed therapeutic school from preschool through high school.  

  

Specialty services include the New Jersey suicide prevention helpline and peer help lines for police, veterans, active military, teachers, mothers of special needs children and child protective service workers. In FY2016, UBHC treated 16,199 consumers, had 24,502 admissions, and touched the lives of 19,441 individual callers through peer support. In addition, UBHC is the primary mental health training resource for the New Jersey departments of Human Services, Children and Families, and Corrections, delivering 16,000 trainings each year.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers The State University is seeking a Mental Health Clinician III within Rutgers University Behavioral Healthcare.  

  

Under direction, the primary purpose of the Mental Health Clinician III is to provide comprehensive evaluation, assessment and therapeutic intervention to address the psychological, emotional and social needs of individuals served by the unit. Duties include formulating evaluations, developing and implementing treatment plans, conducting individual, group, and family therapy and providing case management functions.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Contributes to and supports goals and objectives of the Department and UBHC.
* Consistently behaves in accordance with established department and UBHC policies and procedures as observed by supervisor.
* Actively participates in and contributes to smooth functioning of the department and demonstrates initiative and flexibility regarding work assignments as observed by supervisor and administration feedback.
* Effectively contributes to and supports an environment that enhances the positive self-image of individuals served and preserves their human dignity as observed by supervisor.
* Maintains effective, open communication with members of the treatment team as evidenced by supervisory observation and team members’ feedback.
* Consistently ensures the individuals served’ rights to fair and equitable treatment, self-determination, individuality, privacy and civil rights are maintained as observed by supervisor and feedback from peers, patients and their families.
* Actively participates in programs and department-wide meetings as assigned and observed by supervisor and program administration.

title: Office Assistant
description:
**About Metergy** 

Metergy Solutions, LLC is vertically integrated, offering complete submetering solutions including equipment, field service and billing services for residential and commercial buildings. The company’s systems are widely deployed, with hundreds of thousands of submeters in the United States and Canada.

It is a wholly own subsidiary of one of North America’s most experienced submetering providers Metergy Solutions Inc. which is a portfolio company of Brookfield Infrastructure. Brookfield is one of the world’s largest investors, owners, and operators of infrastructure assets across the utilities, transport, energy, data, and sustainable resources sectors. This sponsorship provides Metergy with access to large-scale capital, infrastructure investment expertise and global reach.

For more information about Quadlogic or Metergy, please visit us

online https://www.quadlogic.com/ or https://www.metergysolutions.com/

**Our Mission** 

Provide building owners and occupants with accurate and reliable utility consumption data through market-leading expertise in turnkey submetering and billing, while fostering a workplace with inspired team members empowered to do more good.

**Office & Operations Coordinator/Assistant**

**Role Overview:**

The Office and Operations Coordinator is a key support role providing dedicated administrative assistance to the US President while ensuring the smooth operation of office activities. The role requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to handle confidential information with discretion. A focus on efficiency and strong communication is essential for ensuring both executive and office tasks are handled effectively.

**Location:** Long Island City, NY

**Hybrid role:** 2-3 days in office after training

**Compensation:** $50,000 - $62,000 base + 5% annual bonus + benefits

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Executive Support**

* Provide comprehensive administrative support to the US President, as well as for the Executive Leadership Team
* Manage and coordinate the President’s calendar, meetings, and travel arrangements.
* Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, and presentations.
* Develop meeting minutes and coordinate completion of action items on schedule.
* Support and contribute to the development and maintenance of business and operational reports.
* Develop and contribute to internal documentation of policies and procedures

**Office Administration**

* Oversee and streamline daily office operations to ensure smooth functioning.
* Maintain File organization in SharePoint for internal operations
* Answer incoming calls or inquiries. Greeting visitors.
* Manages inbound/outbound mail, courier services and other correspondence.
* Meeting room bookings, prep and maintenance for group meetings and events.
* Liaise with property management to address facility needs and issues.
* Handle office supply management, equipment maintenance, and vendor relationships.
* Perform administrative tasks including filing, data entry, and managing office correspondence. Maintain accurate records and documentation for office operations.
* Support the coordination and planning of local team events and activities.
* Help with ad hoc operations tasks and provide administrative support to local teams, as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* 1-2 years of experience in a similar role within a fast paced, professional office working environment.
* Professional demeanor and an effective communicator
* Enthusiastic and friendly, with a customer centric mindset and approach.
* Excellent organizational skills. Demonstrates the ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple priorities.
* Manage documentation with an acute attention to detail and acts with a high level of discretion when handling confidential and sensitive information.
* Proactive, diligent and capable of working both independently and as part of a team.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and familiar with office management software.

Metergy is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected status. We strive to create an inclusive and diverse workplace for all.

title: Clinic Director / De Novo Partner - South Amboy, NJ
description:
Position Summary:


Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! Together, we provide world-class care in physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and applied behavior analysis (ABA) services. Our culture promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for exceptional care for every patient.


Job Description:

**Full-time** **Clinic Director &** **De Novo** **Partner**

*Ivy Rehab Physical Therapy – Start-up Outpatient Ortho Clinic*

 *\\*\\** *Must be a* *L**icensed Physical Therapist to be considered for this opportunity as there* *are**treatment* *expectation**s* *for our Clinic Directors. \\*\\**

  

Location**:**


We are open to exploring locations closest to you. We go where the talent and patients are! Please note this clinic does not exist yet and you will have the unique opportunity to partner with us to pick out the perfect location!


Opportunity Overview:

*Have you thought about opening your own clinic? Look no further! Join a leading national provider in outpatient orthopedics and partner with us to start-up, run, and have equity in your very own clinic (or clinics) in your local community. We are looking for a partner with an entrepreneurial spirit and a GSD mindset. Not only are you the* *leader* *of your clinic**, but you will* *directly* *benefit* *from the clinic's success as a partner!*

  

Who is Ivy Rehab?

  

Ivy Rehab is a national provider with close to 600 orthopedic, pediatric, and ABA outpatient clinics! More than half of our locations are De Novo (start-up) clinics opened by our very own clinicians. We are an entrepreneurial organization that invests in their clinicians and promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for providing excellent care to every single patient who walks into our clinics. At Ivy you are a teammate, not an employee.

  

Why Should I Partner with Ivy?

* Full Clinic Director compensation, bonus structure, benefits package, CEU resources, promotional opportunities, and annual increases on top of clinic equity.
* Whether you currently have leadership experience or are looking to take the next step in your career, we will provide all the necessary training and development needed before you open your clinic and start growing your team!
* Ivy's support with picking out the best clinic location, building and recruiting your dream team, marketing/business development, legal, compliance, patient engagement software, IT, HR, payor contracts, accounting, revenue cycle, etc.
* Fantastic track record of opening de novos and getting sustained profitability.
* Regional leadership training, guidance, and mentorship.
* Internal De Novo Business School
*If you are interested in learning more about our partnership model or want to sign up for one of our informational webinars click here:* https://www.ivyrehab.com/take-care-of-your-dreams/

  

What We Have to Offer:

* **Exceptional Partnerships:** Ivy Rehab is partnered with Hospital for Special Surgery (HSS), Gray Institute, Institute of Physical Art, and Herman & Wallace Pelvic Rehabilitation Institute.
* **Clinical and Professional Development:** We offer 7 different residency programs for our PTs with no reduction in pay or hours (Ortho - HSS, Sports-HSS, Pelvic, Vestibular, Oncology, Hand, and Pediatric), peer to peer learning, journal clubs, specialty teams/programs, unlimited CEUs, clinical career ladder, leadership development and coaching, in-house business school and so much more!
* **Exceeding Expectations:** Ivy Rehab’s commitment to quality care is recognized by CMS as exceptional in the MIPS program with a score of 98/100 points in 2023!
* **Incentives Galore:** Enjoy CEU dollars annually, mentor/CI incentives, or student loan repayment / competitive sign-on bonus for certain opportunities.
* **Empowering Values:** We live by our values - One Ivy, Love what you do, Do the right thing, I belong, GSD (Get Stuff Done), Grow, and Serve others.
  

What You Will Need:

* An entrepreneurial spirit.
* Graduate from an accredited Physical Therapy Program.
* Proof of current or pending state licensure as a Physical Therapist in respective state.
* Dedication to exceptional patient outcomes and providing great quality of care.
* Passion for leading and mentoring others.
 *We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of the recruiting and employment process.* *Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, specialty, education, and organizational need.* *Any listed base salary range or contractual rate* does not include *clinic director bonuses/incentives, equity, differential pay, CEU dollars, sign-on bonuses, student loan repayment, or other forms of compensation or benefits.*

title: Home Based ABA Provider
description:
About Windwatch Behavioral Services:

Here at Windwatch Behavioral Services, we provide support and guidance to staff, parents, and most importantly, children, in those areas they will need for healthy social, emotional, and behavioral development. This includes developing and implementing innovative and effective strategies and plans to help support a student’s behavioral needs while in school and home while at the same time providing support and assistance to your staff and parents when a student encounters obstacles that may impact their learning and development. As you know, these obstacles can present and be perceived in many different forms, especially in young children; what may seem typical or routine to you and I can oftentimes seem insurmountable in the mind of a child. These can range from the relatively benign, such as changes in the classroom environment or an increase in academic demands, to the more significant, including changes in the home environment, illness, and family challenges. Events like these can lead to behavioral changes in students of all ages. Our paramount responsibility at Windwatch is to work with your students, staff, and families to ensure a quick return to a typical developmental pattern that will allow for an effective and productive learning experience while in school.

In line with our process, we will work with your staff, children, and their families both directly and indirectly. More succinctly, we will work individually with your students and cooperatively and collaboratively with your staff toward our mutual goal of ensuring children are best positioned to learn and make progress. This in not only our mission, but our passion

Job Description:

This position offers an hourly opportunity within a home setting. For school year is 5-10 hours a week, BIS and Parent Training with middle school and high school age students.

Our commitment is to deliver exceptional behavioral treatment to individuals in need. Prospective candidates should apply only if they possess the physical capability to effectively manage challenging behaviors. Comprehensive training and supervision will be provided by a Licensed Behavior Analyst.

Applicants are expected to have fundamental knowledge and experience in:

* Behavioral Data Collection
* Implementation of Behavior Intervention Plans
* Collaboration within a team environment, including teachers, school psychologists, aides, administrators, and other service providers
* Receptivity to Feedback

Further training will be provided, with hours accrued in this role applicable towards RBT, BCaBA, BCBA, or LBA certifications. Opportunities for advancement within the agency, such as school-based behavior consultant roles, are also available.

We offer competitive hourly rates, typically exceeding those of other local agencies in the behavior/ABA services sector. Compensation is commensurate with direct experience, relevant degrees, and certifications. Credentials unrelated to our mission are not considered in compensation offers. Master’s level Special Education teachers with active certification and experience can anticipate starting rates of $50-$70 per hour.

Job Type: Part-time Pay Range: $35-$70 per hour Expected Hours: 10 hours per week

Benefits include professional development assistance and supervision from a Licensed Behavior Analyst.

Schedule: After School, Monday-Friday (No Weekends) Work Setting: In-home Location: Kings Park, NY: In-person

Education Requirements:

Any of the following:

Special Education Teacher, Masters in Applied Behavior Analysis, BCBA, LBA, RBT, BT, BCaBA

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $35.00 - $70.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 10 per week

* Kings Park, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Account Manager
description:
Job Summary:

**If you feel you’d make a great fit for us, we would love to hear from you! Please send a brief email about why you are right for this position along with a spell-checked resume in PDF format to: careers@lukelampco.com.**

We are a high-end lighting design and manufacturing studio (www.lukelampco.com) looking for an Account Manager to play a key role in delivering high quality service and support to our clients in all areas of the specifying and ordering process. We take pride in being friendly, detail-oriented, and always going above and beyond, and we are looking for someone who is committed to carrying on these standards.

This role will be a hybrid position - you must be able to be in our NYC Nolita showroom, as well as our Mamaroneck, NY studio, 2-3 days per week (or more as needed).

Duties/Responsibilities

* Become proficient in the sales process, technical details, limitations and customization options for all Luke Lamp Co. products.
* Handle incoming inquiries that are received via email and phone.
* Manage the sales process from initial inquiry through purchase, including responding to RFQs, preparing quotes, and generating invoices.
* Lead sales meetings to educate clients on our products, understand their needs, and assist them in the design process.
* Work with our engineering team in the creation of 3D models and shop drawings for custom projects, ensuring that the client information is accurately conveyed.
* Perform proactive outreach to current and prospective clients and assist with other sales initiatives.
* Help maintain a knowledge base of customer inquiries and product information.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills/Qualifications: *Please note that the below qualifications are meant to serve as a guideline. If you feel you’ll make a great fit, we want to hear more!*

* Experience working with interior design/architecture firms, lighting, or high-end retail/showroom environments preferred.
* Familiarity with the commercial specifying and purchasing process is a plus.
* Ability to think creatively in order to understand and visualize client requests.
* Experience with CAD software such as Revit, AutoCAD and SketchUp and/or an understanding of how to interpret architectural drawings/plans.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills. We value responding to clients in a friendly, timely, and concise manner.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.

Our Values

* We are committed to constantly improving our production processes.
* We seek to provide the best tool for every task.
* We value a positive, supportive work environment.
* We listen to employee feedback and are open to new ideas.

Benefits

* Quarterly profit sharing bonus
* Healthcare Reimbursement Program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Tuition Reimbursement

title: Associate Director, Solid Tumors Global Commercial Insights & Analytics
description:
Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is recruiting for an Associate Director, Solid Tumors Global Commercial Insights & Analytics within the Global Commercial Strategy Organization (GCSO) in Raritan, NJ.



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges. We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued, and our people can reach their potential.



As Associate Director, Solid Tumors Global Commercial Insights & Analytics your primary role is to help shape solid tumors oncology pipeline strategies through assessing current pipeline assets, emerging modalities and targets, continuous monitoring, primary and secondary research of disease and treatment landscape, as well as key competitors’ strategies and tactics for clinical development and commercialization and translating insights into implications for J&J solid tumor portfolio.



In this critical role, you will also be responsible for new business development analytics to support commercial evaluations for key business development projects in the solid tumor disease areas.



As an integral part of our Global Commercial Insights team (GCI), you will closely collaborate with other GCI team members responsible for insights generation and forecasting analytics supporting the same early and late development portfolio and together play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making, by integrating insights from forecast modeling, primary & secondary research and competitive intelligence.



Responsibilities:


* Help shape disease and pipeline assets strategy through gathering and analyzing competitive insights:


o Track current and future competitive landscape and development of key competitors (e.g. trial design, timeline, recruiting status, data read-out)



o Interpret the competitive information to derive implications and form recommendations.



o Lead competitive intelligence gathering, interpretation, and communication during key scientific congresses



o Lead regular competitive landscape reviews and updates to ensure the organization has a strong understanding and perspective of the emerging science in prioritized disease areas.


* Help shape disease and pipeline assets strategy through gathering and analyzing market research insights such as:


o Disease and treatment landscape research using secondary data/syndicated reports



o KOL primary market research to understand study design, current and future competitors and clinical trial benchmarks



o Qualitative TPP research


* Support the exploration/assessment of new opportunities both in early and business development setting:


o Monitor the landscape, track the emerging targets/MOAs for potential opportunities



o Support New Molecular Entity (NME) declarations by providing insights into key competitive landscape



o Help conduct due diligence of early-stage opportunities and commercial evaluation for business development projects



o Inform TPP and Forecast for early development with in-depth understanding of the competitive landscape



o Perform critical business analytics and build forecasts to support commercial evaluation of assets in business development


* Communication & collaboration:


o Collaborate with global strategic marketing partners and inform strategic planning processes



o Collaborate with regional teams on key business processes, share resources and learnings



o Manage external vendors for projects under responsibility



o Manage assigned budget



o In collaboration with other GCI team members, enhance functional insights and analytics capabilities by improving processes, leveraging innovative tools and adopting best practice

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* A minimum of a Bachelor's degree & 8 years of progressive business experience is required in relevant areas such as Marketing, Market Research, Quantitative Sciences, Business Analytics, Competitive Intelligence and Business Development, or
* An MBA or advanced degree and a minimum of 5 years of progressive business experience is required in relevant areas such as Marketing, Market Research, Quantitative Sciences, Business Analytics, Competitive Intelligence and Business Development
* Working knowledge of key secondary data sources to gather intelligence is required.
* Ability to work in the Raritan, NJ office 3 days a week is required.
* Experience in oncology is preferred.
* Experience in solid-tumor space is preferred.


Functional & Leadership skills


* Data Analysis: proven ability to collect, analyze data, and generate actionable insights and recommendations.
* Business context and implications: ability to frame data/insight and impact in the context of both External (Competitors set, Market Access, Economic etc) and Internal environment
* Strategic Communication & Storytelling: ability to communicate complex ideas and concepts clearly and effectively, aligning diverse stakeholders through compelling storytelling.
* Strategic Thinking: translating data and trends into actionable insights and strategies with a natural ability to look at the “total picture”; combining global perspective with strong business acumen to shape business strategies.
* Collaboration: building and leveraging networks, driving high-performance results through cross-functional partnerships.
* Influencing & Negotiating: effectively influencing diverse stakeholders to achieve business objectives, leading with or without direct authority.
* Project Management: providing strategic direction and oversight for multiple projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Budget and vendor management
* Operational Excellence: delivering immediate business results while identifying opportunities for future improvements.
* Critical Thinking & Prioritization: strong ability to cut through the noise, validate root causes with commercial leads, and strategically summarize context and recommendations.
* Learning Agility: adapting to new disease areas or functional skills, driving change and navigating through uncertainty.
* Navigating Ambiguity: leading with stability in uncertain environments, adept at working within matrix organizations.

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $118,000 to $203,550. The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. · Please use the following language:


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market."



Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.



For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

title: Intake Coordinator - Home Care
description:
**Intake Coordinator**

**Job description**

**Intake Coordinators are responsible for processing referrals received from marketing sources such as hospitals, nursing homes, and community physicians. Coordinators contact each patient to educate them on the services we can provide and assist them with their homecare needs for skilled and non-skilled services. In this important position Intake Coordinators accept the great responsibility of following a patient from the date of discharge through enrollment for long term care, keeping the patient and family members informed at all times to ensure all patients have caring and professional experience with our Multiple Home Care Partners.**

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:**

**Receive referrals from referral sources**

**Verify patient’s insurance to determine eligibility**

**Educate patients on services we provide**

**Send referral to MLTC for potential enrollment or Medicaid assistance**

**Send referral to appropriate CHHA for skilled services**

**Determine what services were approved by insurance**

**Ensure agency receives authorization for MLTC cases and provide case specifics to agency's HHA Coordination**

**Job Type: Full-time**

**Salary: $22.00 - $29.00 per hour**

**Expected hours: 40 per week**

**Benefits:**

* **401(k) matching**
* **Dental insurance**
* **Life insurance**
* **Paid time off**
* **Vision insurance**

**Healthcare setting:**

* **Long term care**

* **Home Health**

**Schedule:**

* **Monday to Friday**
* **No weekends**

**Work Location: In person**

Job Type: Full-time

description:
Welcome to Bob’s Discount Furniture, where professionalism meets FUN, and every day is an opportunity to shine!

As a Retail Guest Experience Specialist, you’ll be at the forefront of Bob’s success story, helping us maintain our position as a leader in the industry. Our commitment to the "Bob’s Way" means delivering unparalleled customer service without the gimmicks, ensuring each shopper enjoys a transparent and enjoyable shopping journey.

Our founder, Bob Kaufman, said it best: "No phony sales, no phony gimmicks, just everyday low prices and value! We call it the Bob’s Way because no one does it better!"

The Care Coordinator plays a critical role in our mission to support the HIV/AIDS community. Skills:

title: Direct Support Professional / DSP
description:
**We are hiring for:**


Direct Support Professional / DSP**Type:**


Regular
If you are a positive and personable individual looking for a satisfying and fun opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of people with intellectual, developmental disabilities, and people facing mental health, and substance use challenges, join our team at RHA Health Services!


Provides support for individuals and/or groups of persons with disabilities in the community. Assists the person(s) receiving services in identifying and communicating his or her requests and needs for services and supports. Implements services and supports to address the person’s goals and desired outcomes as identified through each person’s Centered Plan. Seek to understand the individuals in the context of their personal history, their social and family networks, and their hopes and dreams for the future. Relies on direction and supervision to accomplish the job. Requires High School Diploma or GED at least 18 years of age and valid adult drivers’ license.
Bring your skills and passion to our team of dedicated caregivers as a Direct Support Professional and watch your efforts make a difference in the lives of people with disabilities. In this rewarding, entry-level role you will be a key member of a care team, helping people identify and achieve their goals and live their best lives. From one day to the next, you’ll wear many hats — advocate, cheerleader, teacher, shopping partner, role model, coach, and more — supporting people in both their home and community. Requires Valid High School Diploma or GED, at least 18 years of age and valid adult drivers’ license.

**Pay:** $18.75/hr

**Schedule:** 40hrs Full time / Part time positions

**Available Shifts at LODI, NJ :**

**16 Hrs:** Saturday and Sunday 7am - 3pm

**16 hrs:** Friday and Saturday 3pm - 11pm

**26 hrs:** Overnights: Thursday 11pm -9am, Friday 11pm -7am, Saturday 11pm -7am

**34 hrs:** Thursday 11pm -9am, Friday 11pm -7am, Saturday 7am-3pm, Saturday 11pm -7am

* Accompany people to work, the movies, concerts, shopping, and other community outings.

* Foster positive relationships within the community.
* Promote decision-making about living, work, and social relationships.

* Document the care you provide.
* Understand diverse challenges of those living with disabilities and use effective advocacy strategies.
* Connect people with resources to further explore opportunities in their career, education, volunteerism, etc.
* Promote effective communication.
* Assist in medication administration where state law allows.
* Protect confidentiality.

* Valid High School Diploma/ High School Passing Certificate or GED OR College education
* At least 18 years of age
* Valid driver’s license
* Pushing/Pulling/Carrying up to 50 pounds. Heavy Lifting/Transferring

* The successful completion of training to dispense medications to consumers will be required if the assigned consumers require staff members to administer their medications.

**Skill requirements:**

* Conflict resolution
* Some computer skills preferred.
* Decision making
* Communication skills

* Ability to maintain confidentiality.

  

#INDNJ

title: PT Basketball Teacher/Steady
description:
DESCRIPTION:

**BASKETBALL TEACHER. Part-Time**

Hiring NOW ! for our Fall/Winter Season

Can you teach children how to play basketball? If you enjoy working with kids and know the game of basketball, this could be your job. First Shot Basketball School has been teaching children how to play the game since 1997. Students range in age from 3-15.

This is a hands-on job where our teachers actually teach the fundamentals, play games with the students and instruct basic skills like pass, dribble, shoot, etc. We don’t have teams and “winning” is not a priority.

Your love of children and an **outgoing personality is as important as your basketball skills.** **You must know how to engage kids at their level, make it fun and encourage them to succeed.** 

**If you do not have experience, you will not be considered.**

Classes are held in different Queens locations on weekends from 9:00AM to 3:30PM. Additional Friday 1 hour afternoon class.

**We are interviewing now for 2 high-energy teachers who can work Saturdays and/or Sundays - Special opportunity for a one hour Friday afternoon class.**

**WE ONLY HIRE ONLY PEOPLE WITH THESE QUALIFICATIONS:**

1. Great love and patience for children

2. Extremely reliable and responsible

3. Experience with young children

4. Good Basketball Skills and ability to teach them

5. Good sense of humor & contagious smile

**You must live in the Queens area.** It would also help to have a vehicle at your disposal since public transportation is difficult to some locations.

Salary commensurate with your experience and abilities. Starting at $35 per class, upgraded as deserved. Classes run 1 hr., 1 hr/15 mins and 1 hr./45 min.

Email a cover letter outlining why you are qualified and attach a Resume.

**No Phone Calls.**
